type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","headline":"Italy's banks support ECB's digital euro plan, but want to spread out costs over time: Reuters","url":"https://www.theblock.co/post/378105/italys-banks-support-ecbs-digital-euro-plan-but-want-to-spread-out-costs-over-time-reuters","thumbnailUrl":"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2022/10/20221012_EuropeanVC_CryptoFunds_Feature-1200x675.jpg","articleSection":"Policy","creator":["Zack Abrams"],"keywords":["digital-euro","European Commission"],"publisher":{"@type":"NewsMediaOrganization","name":"The Block","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://www.tbstat.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,width=150/wp/uploads/2022/10/tb2-logo-black.png"}},"description":"EU finance ministers recently reached a compromise agreement with the ECB on the plan to roll out a digital euro, expected by 2029. ","articleBody":"\u003Cp>Italy's banks support the European Central Bank's effort to introduce a 'digital euro' central bank digital currency (CBDC), a top official of the Italian Banking Association (ABI) said at a press seminar, according to a recent Reuters report.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>However, the banks want to spread out the upfront capital expenditures by banks over time, as the costs are high, ABI General Manager Marco Elio Rottigni said at a press conference, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/italys-banks-back-digital-euro-want-costs-spread-over-time-2025-11-08/\">per the report\u003C/a>. Rottigni also said the banks are in favor of the proposal because \"it embodies a concept of digital sovereignty.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The comments come mere weeks after EU finance ministers, European Central Bank (ECB) president Christine Lagarde, and European Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/371534/eu-finance-ministers-set-roadmap-to-launch-digital-euro-though-issuance-could-take-years-reuters\">reached a compromise agreement\u003C/a> on how to proceed with the controversial proposal. Per the agreement, the finance ministers will have a say on whether or not a digital euro is issued and how much money each EU resident will be able to hold in the digital euro, in order to assuage fears of bank runs.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The digital euro is currently projected to launch in 2029, according to the report, contingent on the EU adopting legislation next year and a pilot phase for the digital euro in 2027. Yet Rottigni told reporters that the Italian banking association favors a dual approach in order to keep pace with other jurisdictions. The United States, for example, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/363425/trump-signs-stablecoin-genius-act-cementing-first-major-crypto-framework-in-us-law\">passed\u003C/a> its stablecoin-regulating GENIUS Act this past year.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"We're in favour of a twin approach, a central bank digital currency and commercial bank digital currencies which may develop faster, because what Europe shouldn't do is fall behind,\" Rottigni said.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>However, the plan has faced pushback from big banks, including the German Banking Industry Committee (the nation's top banking lobbying group) and conservative MEP Fernando Navarrete, the Financial Times \u003Ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/1654675a-9e8f-4a5e-b174-730ae0c3ab37\">recently reported\u003C/a>. Navarrete has previously expressed concerns about adopting the digital euro, and has recently argued for a scaled-down version of the project that would see the euro used for payments without internet connection, but not for other real-time transactions.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"The digital euro should not cater for payments between financial intermediaries, payment service providers and other market participants (that is to say wholesale payments), for which settlement systems in central bank money exist and where the use of different technologies is being further investigated by the Eurosystem,\" Navarrete said in \u003Ca href=\"https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/ECON-PR-778136_EN.docx\">a report published last week.\u003C/a>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. As of November 2023, Foresight Ventures is a majority investor of The Block. Foresight Ventures invests in \u003Ca href=\"https://www.foresightventures.com/portfolio\">other companies\u003C/a> in the crypto space. Crypto exchange Bitget is an anchor LP for Foresight Ventures. The Block continues to operate independently to deliver objective, impactful, and timely information about the crypto industry. Take</h4>
<ul>
<li>Italy’s banks support the European Central Bank’s plan to introduce a digital euro but want its required investments to be spread out over time, a top official of Italy’s banking association said, per Reuters.</li>
<li>The ECB in recent weeks has advanced its plan to introduce a digital euro, finalizing a roadmap with EU finance ministers to develop the central bank digital currency (CBDC), projected to launch in 2029 given EU approval next year.</li>
</ul>
</div></div><span data-v-91276385></span><div class="my-6 py-4 print:hidden" data-v-91276385><div class="mb-2 text-center text-xs text-gray-500 opacity-50" data-v-91276385> Advertisement </div><div class="flex justify-center" data-v-91276385><span data-v-91276385></span></div></div><!----><div id="articleContent" class="article-content relative w-full" data-v-91276385><!--[--><div class="fallback-content"><p>Italy's banks support the European Central Bank's effort to introduce a 'digital euro' central bank digital currency (CBDC), a top official of the Italian Banking Association (ABI) said at a press seminar, according to a recent Reuters report.</p>
<p>However, the banks want to spread out the upfront capital expenditures by banks over time, as the costs are high, ABI General Manager Marco Elio Rottigni said at a press conference, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/italys-banks-back-digital-euro-want-costs-spread-over-time-2025-11-08/">per the report</a>. Rottigni also said the banks are in favor of the proposal because "it embodies a concept of digital sovereignty."</p>
<p>The comments come mere weeks after EU finance ministers, European Central Bank (ECB) president Christine Lagarde, and European Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis <a href="https://www.theblock.co/post/371534/eu-finance-ministers-set-roadmap-to-launch-digital-euro-though-issuance-could-take-years-reuters">reached a compromise agreement</a> on how to proceed with the controversial proposal. Per the agreement, the finance ministers will have a say on whether or not a digital euro is issued and how much money each EU resident will be able to hold in the digital euro, in order to assuage fears of bank runs.</p>
<p>The digital euro is currently projected to launch in 2029, according to the report, contingent on the EU adopting legislation next year and a pilot phase for the digital euro in 2027. Yet Rottigni told reporters that the Italian banking association favors a dual approach in order to keep pace with other jurisdictions. The United States, for example, <a href="https://www.theblock.co/post/363425/trump-signs-stablecoin-genius-act-cementing-first-major-crypto-framework-in-us-law">passed</a> its stablecoin-regulating GENIUS Act this past year.</p>
<p>"We're in favour of a twin approach, a central bank digital currency and commercial bank digital currencies which may develop faster, because what Europe shouldn't do is fall behind," Rottigni said.</p>
<p>However, the plan has faced pushback from big banks, including the German Banking Industry Committee (the nation's top banking lobbying group) and conservative MEP Fernando Navarrete, the Financial Times <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1654675a-9e8f-4a5e-b174-730ae0c3ab37">recently reported</a>. Navarrete has previously expressed concerns about adopting the digital euro, and has recently argued for a scaled-down version of the project that would see the euro used for payments without internet connection, but not for other real-time transactions.</p>
<p>"The digital euro should not cater for payments between financial intermediaries, payment service providers and other market participants (that is to say wholesale payments), for which settlement systems in central bank money exist and where the use of different technologies is being further investigated by the Eurosystem," Navarrete said in <a href="https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/ECON-PR-778136_EN.docx">a report published last week.</a></p><br /><span class="copyright"><p>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lawrence Lee, Chairman of\u003C/span>\u003C/i>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.osl.com/hk-en\"> \u003Ci>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">OSL Group\u003C/span>\u003C/i>\u003C/a>\u003Ci>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> and Chair of the Finternet Committee, delivered opening remarks at the\u003C/span>\u003C/i>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.osl.com/hk-en/press-release/finternet-2025-summit-key-highlights?channel=7rm1br\"> \u003Ci>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Finternet 2025 – Asia Digital Finance Summit\u003C/span>\u003C/i>\u003C/a>\u003Ci>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> on November 4th 2025 in Hong Kong.\u003C/span>\u003C/i>\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> \u003C/p>\n","HONG KONG, November 4, 2025  Good morning, distinguished guests, esteemed regulators, innovators, and leaders from around the world. As Chairman of the Finternet Committee, the organizer of this summit, it is my great pleasure to welcome you. It wasnt long ago that the two worlds represented in this roomthe world of traditional, structured finance, […]","\u003Cp>\u003Cb>HONG KONG, November 4, 2025\u003C/b>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">  Good morning, distinguished guests, esteemed regulators, innovators, and leaders from around the world.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As Chairman of the Finternet Committee, the organizer of this\u003C/span>\u003Ca rel=\"sponsored\" href=\"https://finternet.asia/\"> \u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">summit\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, it is my great pleasure to welcome you.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It wasnt long ago that the two worlds represented in this roomthe world of traditional, structured finance, and the world of decentralized, digital nativesviewed each other from a distance, perhaps even with suspicion.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Today, we are gathered in one room, in this magnificent venue. This fact alone signals that a new era of convergence has truly begun.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And I can think of no better place for this convergence than Hong Kong. This city has always been a bridgebetween East and West, between established order and new frontiers. Today, it is poised to become the strategic bridge for the Financial Internet.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We are here because we are witnessing an explosive growth in the Web3 world. This is not a niche experiment. We are discussing a verifiable, non-negligible economic force.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The IMF recently noted that the total market capitalization of crypto-assets has surpassed US$3.5 trillion. The market cap of stablecoins alone has exceeded US$230 billion, reaching unprecedented levels.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But this growth is not just about the numbers on a screen. It is about a fundamental shift.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">At its heart, this is a novel technological frameworkdriven by what we now commonly call blockchain technology, which is characterized by its decentralized nature. This has created a new economic ecology.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Some have called this the \"great rewiring\" of the web. It's a system designed to change how informationand now, valueis stored, shared, and owned. This new ecology is nurturing boundless innovation and entirely new business models.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nurturing this boundless innovation, in turn, requires its own lifeblood: digital assets, or as they are more commonly known, cryptocurrencies. In various forms and shapes, they provide the fuel for this new world, and in doing so, they are creating new, programmable pathways for how value is defined, managed, and exchanged.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And this leads us to what many believe is a more profound evolution in this space: Tokenization. This is a limitless invention where our own imagination is the only limit.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Think about the journey: a decade ago, Bitcoin was a concept. Today, its value has grown from virtually nothing to, at its peak, over US$120,000, capturing the serious attention of institutional investors. Now, forecasters are projecting that the \u003C/span>\u003Ci>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">broader\u003C/span>\u003C/i>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> tokenization market will grow from billions to trillions within the next decade.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As someone who has spent decades in the world of structured finance and law, I must address the other side of this explosive growth.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This very innovationthe speed, the new architectures, the new pathwayshas, understandably, created profound concerns.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It has created concerns not just within the traditional world, but within the industry itself.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We do not have to look far. The markets immense volatility is not an illusion. The historic liquidations of the crypto market we witnessed just last monthevents that the press has dubbed a \"flash crash\"are not accidental anomalies.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">They are a profound reminder. They are a systemic stress test.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">They are the growing pains of an industry moving from adolescence to adulthood. They are the friction that occurs when a 1.0 world of \"permissionless\" innovation collides with the 2.0 world of \"permissioned\" trust.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This is the turning point we find ourselves at today.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The 1.0 era of speculative hype, while exciting, must now give way to the 2.0 era. An era defined not by hype, but by utility. An era defined by \"Real Solutions for the Real Economy.\"\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And this, ladies and gentlemen, is the central mission of this forum.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Our mission is to find the \"Equilibrium.\"\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">How do we build this equilibrium? We believe it depends on establishing a broad, compliant, and trusted \"Financial Internet\"which is the very definition of \"Finternet.\"\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This new network cannot be built on code alone. It must be built on a foundation of \"constructive global dialogue.\" It requires the innovators in T-shirts and the custodians in suits to speak the same language. It requires a shared understanding between regulators, entrepreneurs, and the institutions that safeguard our global financial system.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And the ultimate purpose of this network, its only true mission, must be to serve the real economy.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The paths to this mission are the very topics you will explore todayfor example, developing robust frameworks for Real-World Asset tokenization, and building compliant, efficient payment networks.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">On the payment front, the potential is already clearly visible. A recent industry report, co-authored by institutions including the digital asset data solutions provider Artemis, and Asias leading stablecoin trading and payment infrastructure, OSL Group, found that while stablecoin payment volumes are still small, their annual growth rate is nearly ten times that of traditional payment networks, driven primarily by the explosive growth in B2B payments.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This is not just macro data; we are seeing real-world validation. Take OSL Group as an example. Its licensed payments business in Europe, launched this year as a dedicated step in its strategic transformation, achieved significant results in a very short period, powerfully validating the market's urgent demand for compliant solutions. Currently, OSL is actively deploying over 50 related licenses for trading and payments in more than 10 key markets globally, which fully demonstrates the immense potential of compliant payments.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The demand is real.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This, is what \"real solutions\" look like. This, is the work that trusted, licensed participants must undertake: to build a global compliance network, ultimately bridging the new force of digital assets with the real economy.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It is fitting that we are having this discussion here. We are starting from Hong Kong to connect the globe. This city is a living and dynamic bridge, uniquely positioned to facilitate this global dialogue.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The future of this Financial Internet is not inevitable. It is not pre-written.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The future is up for grabs.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It will be shaped by the choices we make. It will be built by the people in this roomby your ideas, by your willingness to collaborate, and by your courage to solve the hard problems.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This forum is our opportunity to discuss and generate those ideas. This forum, is our golden chance to \"Bridge Ideas with Solutions.\"\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Let us work together to ensure the Finternet we build is not only innovative, but trusted, responsible, and real.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Thank you. overstep': mistrial declared for 'MEV Brothers' accused of $25 million fraud on Ethereum","massive-overstep-mistrial-declared-for-mev-brothers-accused-of-25-million-fraud-on-ethereum",[],"2025-11-08T15:50:39-05:00","3:50PM EST","November 8, 2025, 3:50PM EST","11/08/25","Nov 08, 2025","2025-11-08T15:51:41-05:00","November 8, 2025, 3:51PM EST","by \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/author/zack-abrams\">Zack Abrams\u003C/a>",[180],{"id":181,"name":182,"thumbnail":183,"url":184,"slug":185,"description":186,"isGuestAuthor":19,"meta":187},8688,"Zack Abrams","https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2023/09/Zack-300x300.jpg","https://www.theblock.co/author/zack-abrams","zack-abrams","Zack Abrams is a writer and editor based in Brooklyn, New York. He can be reached via X @zackdabrams or email, zabrams@theblock.co.",{"twitter":188,"linkedin":18,"email":189,"telegram":18},"https://twitter.com/zackdabrams","zabrams@theblock.co",[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/04/20250424_Law_News-1200x675.jpg","\u003Cspan class=\"acf-media-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Ca href=\"theblock.co\" target=\"_blank\">The Block\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>","\u003Ch4>Quick Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>The trial of two MIT-educated brothers accused of orchestrating a $25 million fraud on Ethereum by allegedly exploiting a flaw in MEV-Boost ended in a mistrial after the jury deadlocked in Manhattan federal court.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Coin Center executive director Peter Van Valkenburgh, who wrote an amicus brief in favor of brothers Anton and James Peraire-Bueno, called the case a “massive overstep” by prosecutors in an interview with The Block.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The deadlocked jury had complained that deliberations led some jurors to tears and sleepless nights, Business Insider reported.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","Some jurors were reportedly brought to tears and suffered sleepless nights while deliberating the case of two brothers accused of a $25 million fraud. ","\u003Cp>The four-week trial of two MIT-educated brothers accused of orchestrating a $25 million fraud on Ethereum by federal prosecutors has ended in a mistrial after the jury could not agree on how to apply the law in the case, according to reports.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The brothers, Anton (25) and James (29) Peraire-Bueno, were \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/294707/brothers-arrested-after-doj-says-they-stole-25-million-in-crypto-in-12-seconds-in-ethereum-blockchain-attack\">charged\u003C/a> with conspiracy to commit wire fraud, wire fraud, and conspiracy to commit money laundering by prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in relation to an alleged exploit of MEV-Boost software that netted the brothers $25 million in just 12 seconds.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>However, the brothers' defense countered that the brothers' actions constituted fair play in the competitive space of automatic bot operations on Ethereum, especially those which involve \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/245701/what-is-maximal-extractable-value-mev\">MEV\u003C/a>, the \"maximal/miner extractable value\" that validators can earn by organizing transactions in an optimal way before submitting the block to Ethereum's blockchain.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>In April 2023, just seven months after Ethereum completed its transition to a proof-of-stake validation system after The Merge, the brothers allegedly exploited a flaw in the popular MEV-Boost software to spy on other traders' activity after intentionally \"poisoning\" a block of transactions. With the insight, the brothers were able to use a \"sandwich attack\" to bid up the price of a token before another trader's transaction executes, then sell the tokens at the higher price, pocketing the difference; in their case, the brothers profited $25 million in just 12 seconds.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Yet Peter Van Valkenburgh, executive director of crypto advocacy firm Coin Center, drew a distinction between the brothers' actions and other DeFi exploits  such as Avraham Eisenberg's alleged manipulation of Mango Markets, which was \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/355666/u-s-judge-overturns-fraud-convictions-of-mango-markets-exploiter-eisenberg-determining-improper-venue\">later vacated\u003C/a>  because validators are expected to optimize for MEV in the adversarial world of block-building.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"There's sort of no honor amongst validators,\" Van Valkenburgh said in an interview with The Block. \"The only thing you're expected to do as a validator or as an MEV searcher is to maximize your profits and to only put valid transactions in blocks.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Van Valkenburgh argued in an \u003Ca href=\"https://www.coincenter.org/amicus-brief-in-support-of-peraire-buenos-objections-to-honest-validator-theory-of-fraud/\">amicus brief\u003C/a> submitted to the court that a successful prosecution in the case would \"massively chill public participation\" in permissionless networks, and that the brothers \"appear to have contravened none of the clear rules or controls found within the Ethereum protocol in a manner deserving outside interference or enforcement.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"We want this neutral infrastructure because that's where the efficiencies are,\" Van Valkenburgh said. \"The brilliance behind the system is we wouldn't have to rely on the good behavior of an individual or a nation state. But if we start holding everybody who participates in that neutral infrastructure liable, then we lose that chance.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>While the jurors didn't have trouble understanding the facts of the case, according to a \u003Ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mistrial-mit-brothers-crypto-ethereum-sandwich-bots-peraire-buono-2025-11#:~:text=Half%20of%20the%20jurors%20,the%20judge%20in%20the%20note\">Business Insider report\u003C/a> from inside the courtroom, the jury was deadlocked over how to apply existing law to the case, which the department called a \"first-of-its kind wire fraud and money laundering scheme\" in a \u003Ca href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/pr/two-brothers-arrested-attacking-ethereum-blockchain-and-stealing-25-million#:~:text=unsealing%20of%20an%20Indictment%20charging,S\">statement\u003C/a>. The deliberations left some jurors in tears, and unable to sleep through the night, according to the report. Judge Jessica G. Clarke ended the trial after being convinced that the jury was unlikely to make further progress, given more time.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"A mistrial is not at all surprising to me because, gosh, if I wasn't a crypto person and I was on that jury, I would just be incredibly confused,\" Van Valkenburgh said, calling the prosecution's decision to bring the case a \"massive overstep.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Following the mistrial, the brothers both remain charged with the three counts, leaving the future of the case up to SDNY prosecutors, who can choose to either drop the case or retry the brothers in another effort. Van Valkenburgh said that if prosecutors decide to retry the case, it will signal a continued aggressive push towards the Justice Department establishing jurisdiction over blockchain networks, even under an administration that has \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/352202/crypto-leaders-urge-trump-to-end-lawless-campaign-criminalizing-software-developers-including-roman-storm\">positioned itself as friendlier\u003C/a> to the crypto industry and its developers.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"If they double down [and retry the case], then yeah, it seems to continue to indicate that the Southern District of New York, the prosecutors at least, think that effectively anything that happens on these blockchains is their jurisdiction and that they can awkwardly bodge existing criminal law to apply to all kinds of new factual scenarios,\" Van Valkenburgh said.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The Block was unable to immediately reach SDNY or the brothers' legal defense for comment.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. case against two MIT-educated brothers, Anton and James Peraire-Bueno, due to the jury’s indecision on applying the law.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The brothers were accused of exploiting MEV-Boost software on Ethereum for a $25 million profit by executing a “sandwich attack” that manipulated token prices.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The defense argued their actions were fair in the competitive environment of Ethereum’s automatic bot operations and within the expected practices of maximizing MEV (maximal extractable value).\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Crypto advocacy groups, like Coin Center, supported the brothers by arguing their actions did not contravene Ethereum’s protocols and that a successful prosecution could hinder public participation in permissionless networks.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Jurors struggled with applying existing law to the case, leading to a deadlock and emotional distress, resulting in the judge declaring a mistrial.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The future of the case remains uncertain, hinging on whether SDNY prosecutors will drop the charges or attempt a retrial.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n",{"name":198,"url":199,"id":200,"description":201},"Policy","https://www.theblock.co/category/policy",55001,"\u003Cp>Crypto government policy news & crypto news banks support ECB's digital euro plan, but want to spread out costs over time: Reuters","italys-banks-support-ecbs-digital-euro-plan-but-want-to-spread-out-costs-over-time-reuters",[],"2025-11-08T17:26:32-05:00","5:26PM EST","November 8, 2025, 5:26PM Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>Italy’s banks support the European Central Bank’s plan to introduce a digital euro but want its required investments to be spread out over time, a top official of Italy’s banking association said, per Reuters.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The ECB in recent weeks has advanced its plan to introduce a digital euro, finalizing a roadmap with EU finance ministers to develop the central bank digital currency (CBDC), projected to launch in 2029 given EU approval next year.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","EU finance ministers recently reached a compromise agreement with the ECB on the plan to roll out a digital euro, expected by 2029. ","\u003Cp>Italy's banks support the European Central Bank's effort to introduce a 'digital euro' central bank digital currency (CBDC), a top official of the Italian Banking Association (ABI) said at a press seminar, according to a recent Reuters report.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>However, the banks want to spread out the upfront capital expenditures by banks over time, as the costs are high, ABI General Manager Marco Elio Rottigni said at a press conference, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/italys-banks-back-digital-euro-want-costs-spread-over-time-2025-11-08/\">per the report\u003C/a>. Rottigni also said the banks are in favor of the proposal because \"it embodies a concept of digital sovereignty.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The comments come mere weeks after EU finance ministers, European Central Bank (ECB) president Christine Lagarde, and European Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/371534/eu-finance-ministers-set-roadmap-to-launch-digital-euro-though-issuance-could-take-years-reuters\">reached a compromise agreement\u003C/a> on how to proceed with the controversial proposal. Per the agreement, the finance ministers will have a say on whether or not a digital euro is issued and how much money each EU resident will be able to hold in the digital euro, in order to assuage fears of bank runs.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The digital euro is currently projected to launch in 2029, according to the report, contingent on the EU adopting legislation next year and a pilot phase for the digital euro in 2027. Yet Rottigni told reporters that the Italian banking association favors a dual approach in order to keep pace with other jurisdictions. The United States, for example, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/363425/trump-signs-stablecoin-genius-act-cementing-first-major-crypto-framework-in-us-law\">passed\u003C/a> its stablecoin-regulating GENIUS Act this past year.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"We're in favour of a twin approach, a central bank digital currency and commercial bank digital currencies which may develop faster, because what Europe shouldn't do is fall behind,\" Rottigni said.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>However, the plan has faced pushback from big banks, including the German Banking Industry Committee (the nation's top banking lobbying group) and conservative MEP Fernando Navarrete, the Financial Times \u003Ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/1654675a-9e8f-4a5e-b174-730ae0c3ab37\">recently reported\u003C/a>. Navarrete has previously expressed concerns about adopting the digital euro, and has recently argued for a scaled-down version of the project that would see the euro used for payments without internet connection, but not for other real-time transactions.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"The digital euro should not cater for payments between financial intermediaries, payment service providers and other market participants (that is to say wholesale payments), for which settlement systems in central bank money exist and where the use of different technologies is being further investigated by the Eurosystem,\" Navarrete said in \u003Ca href=\"https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/ECON-PR-778136_EN.docx\">a report published last week.\u003C/a>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. As of November 2023, Foresight Ventures is a majority investor of The Block. euro initiative but want the costs spread out over time due to high upfront capital expenditures.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The banks back the digital euro as it represents “digital sovereignty,” according to ABI General Manager Marco Elio Rottigni.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>An agreement enables EU finance ministers to decide on the digital euro’s issuance and user limits to prevent bank runs.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The digital euro launch is tentatively scheduled for 2029, following legislation adoption and a pilot phase in 2027.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The Italian Banking Association prefers a combined approach of a central bank digital currency and commercial bank digital currencies to compete globally.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Big banks and politicians like MEP Fernando Navarrete have criticized the plan, with some suggesting a scaled-down version for offline payments spot bitcoin ETFs see largest daily outflow since August as BTC price hovers around $100,000","u-s-spot-bitcoin-etfs-see-largest-daily-outflow-since-august-as-btc-price-hovers-around-100000",[],"2025-11-08T13:52:48-05:00","1:52PM EST","November 8, 2025, 1:52PM Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>U.S. spot bitcoin ETFs shed $558 million on Friday, the seventh day of net outflows out of the last eight trading days, as Bitcoin’s price hovers around the $100,000 mark.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Spot Ethereum ETFs saw modest outflows, while the two recently-launched U.S. spot Solana ETFs continued their inflow streak with their ninth straight day of net inflows.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","Meanwhile, the recently-launched U.S. spot Solana ETFs have logged their ninth straight trading day of net positive inflows. ","\u003Cp>U.S. spot bitcoin ETFs on Friday logged $558.4 million worth of net ouflows, the largest single-day outflow sum since Aug. 1, as Bitcoin's price hovers around the $100,000 mark.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Fidelity's FBTC fund, the second-largest spot bitcoin ETF by assets under management (AUM), logged $256.7 million worth of outflows, per \u003Ca href=\"https://sosovalue.com/assets/etf/us-btc-spot\">SoSoValue data\u003C/a>, the most of any fund. Ark & 21Shares' ARKB fund logged the second-highest outflows with $144.2 million on Friday, though those outflows were the highest of any fund when taking into account the funds' overall AUM. BlackRock's industry-leading IBIT fund shed $131.4 million, the third-most in dollar value.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Friday's moves marked the seventh day of net outflows out of the last eight trading days, failing to continue Thursday's inflows that had \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377983/us-spot-bitcoin-etfs-see-240-million-inflows\">halted a six-day outflow streak\u003C/a>. IBIT, FBTC, and ARKB had also logged the most significant inflows of any bitcoin ETF on Thursday.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ciframe frameborder=\"0\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://www.theblock.co/data/etfs/bitcoin-etf/bitcoin-spot-etf-market-share/embed\" title=\"Spot Bitcoin ETF Volume Market Share\" width=\"100%\">\u003C/iframe>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The recent moves have somewhat lessened IBIT's dominance in the market, with its market share currently at about 73.2%, according to The Block's data, down from its three-month high of 82.3% marked in mid-September. IBIT holds nearly 4% of all BTC in its fund.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The price of BTC has traded mostly flat over the past 24 hours, down about 0.62% to its current price of $101,985, according to \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/price/248348/bitcoin-btc-usd\">The Block's Bitcoin Price page\u003C/a>. Despite the volatility, JPMorgan analysts recently projected that the price of the world's largest cryptocurrency could rise to around $170,000 over the next six to 12 months, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377891/jpmorgan-bitcoin-price-170000-next-6-12-months\">The Block previously reported\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Solana ETFs continue their streak\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Though spot Ethereum ETFs saw modest outflows on Friday of $46.6 million, per \u003Ca href=\"https://sosovalue.com/assets/etf/us-eth-spot\">SoSoValue data\u003C/a>, spot Solana ETFs continued their nine-day ongoing net inflow streak with $12.7 million in inflows \u003Ca href=\"https://sosovalue.com/assets/etf/us-sol-spot\">recorded on Friday\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The majority of the inflows continue to accrue to Bitwise's BSOL fund, which has logged $323.8 million worth of cumulative net inflows since the fund \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/376731/bitwise-spot-solana-etf-69-5-million-usd-first-day-inflows-hbar-litecoin\">launched\u003C/a> on Oct. 28; Grayscale's GSOL, which launched the day after and charges a higher fee of 0.35% compared to BSOL's 0.20% (though both funds are currently temporarily waiving fees), has seen only $11.9 million worth of cumulative net inflows.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ciframe frameborder=\"0\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://www.theblock.co/data/etfs/solana-etfs/spot-solana-etf-flows/embed\" title=\"Spot Solana ETF Flows\" width=\"100%\">\u003C/iframe>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The price of solana is currently down about 2.9% in the past 24 hours, according to \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/price/33827/solana-sol-usd\">The Block's Solana Price page\u003C/a>, currently trading at $157.66.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. make it a notable institutional holder of BlackRocks bitcoin ETF, though its stake remains well below those of Goldman Sachs and Millennium Management.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>The filing comes as JPMorgan analysts forecast bitcoin could climb toward $170,000 within a year, even as ETF inflows have slowed since Octobers $20 billion market liquidation.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","JPMorgans IBIT stake, valued at about $333 million at the end of the quarter and around $312 million today, is up 64% from June.","\u003Cp>JPMorgan Chase sharply expanded its exposure to spot-bitcoin ETFs in the third quarter, adding about 2.07 million shares of BlackRocks iShares Bitcoin Trust (ticker IBIT) to end September with 5.28 million in total, according to its latest \u003Ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/19617/000001961725001081/0000019617-25-001081-index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Form 13-F filing\u003C/a> with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>That stake, valued at about $333 million at the end of the quarter and around $312 million today, represents a 64% \u003Ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/19617/000091918525000009/0000919185-25-000009-index.htm\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">increase from June\u003C/a>, when the bank held 3.22 million shares.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The position makes JPMorgan one of several large banks with exposure to BlackRocks bitcoin ETF, though firms such as \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/353873/goldman-sachs-boosts-ibit-holdings-by-28-as-blackrocks-bitcoin-etf-logs-longest-inflow-streak-of-2025\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Goldman Sachs\u003C/a> and Millennium Management hold far larger stakes.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Bitcoin ETF activity has slowed in recent weeks following the historic \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/374266/crypto-liquidations-near-10-billion-in-historic-drawdown-following-trumps-100-tariffs-on-china\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">liquidation\u003C/a> event on Oct. 10, when markets plunged after Trumps 100% tariffs on China erased record open interest across bitcoin and ether.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Inflows have remained muted since the wipeout, with only intermittent positive days, including $240 million in net inflows on Thursday, which ended a six-day streak of outflows.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>BlackRocks IBIT led that days activity with $112 million, according to \u003Ca href=\"https://sosovalue.com/bigChart/Etf_NASDAQ_IBIT?title=iShares%20Bitcoin%20Trust(IBIT)&coin=BTC&page=usBTC\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SoSoValue data\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cdiv>\r\n\u003Cdl id=\"attachment_378088\">\r\n\u003Cdt>\u003Cimg src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/11/IBIT-Flows-800x269.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"800\" height=\"269\" />\u003C/dt>\r\n\u003Cdd>BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) Daily Flows Chart. Source: SoSoValue\u003C/dd>\r\n\u003C/dl>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003Cp data-start=\"1302\" data-end=\"1644\">The timing aligns with JPMorgans more bullish outlook on bitcoin. Analysts at the bank said Wednesday they expect the cryptocurrencys price \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377891/jpmorgan-bitcoin-price-170000-next-6-12-months\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">could reach $170,000\u003C/a> over the next six to 12 months, citing improving volatility relative to gold and signs that the recent wave of crypto-futures deleveraging has largely run its course.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp data-start=\"1646\" data-end=\"1893\">By contrast, JPMorgans holding in BlackRocks iShares Ethereum Trust (ETHA) remains minuscule.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp data-start=\"1646\" data-end=\"1893\">The bank reported 66 fund shares worth about $1,700, down from 111 last quarter, alongside small, offsetting call and put positions of 50,000 contracts each.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. Miran seemed less sure of where the rest of crypto is headed, but said lots of innovation was happening either way.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp class=\"p1\">\u003Cspan class=\"s1\">\"However, I do think there's a lot of innovation happening and that innovation is already starting to have economic consequences of the type that matter for the Fed and of the type that matter for monetary policy,\" Miran added.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp class=\"p1\">\u003Cspan class=\"s1\">Miran assumed his role as Fed chair in September after being \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/370772/senate-confirms-stephen-miran\">\u003Cspan class=\"s2\">confirmed\u003C/span>\u003C/a> by the Senate. Before, he served as chair of the Council of Economic Advisers under President Donald Trump.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp class=\"p1\">\u003Cspan class=\"s1\">On Friday, in a prepared speech at the summit ahead of answering questions, Miran said that the widespread use of stablecoins could put \"downward pressure on interest rates.\" \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp class=\"p1\">\u003Cspan class=\"s4\">\"Even relatively conservative estimates of stablecoin growth imply an increase in the net supply of loanable funds in the economy that pushes down r*,\" Miran said, referring to \u003Cspan class=\"s1\">the \u003Ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/articles/the-hutchins-center-explains-the-neutral-rate-of-interest/#:~:text=The%20neutral%20rate%20of%20interest%20(also%20called%20the%20long%2Drun,is%20neither%20contractionary%20nor%20expansionary\">\u003Cspan class=\"s3\">neutral rate of interest\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003C/span> measured when the \u003Cspan class=\"s1\">economy is at full employment and stable inflation.\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003Cspan class=\"s4\">\"If r* is lower, policy rates should also be lower than they would otherwise be to support a healthy economy.\"\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp class=\"p1\">\u003Cspan class=\"s1\">Miran joined the central bank amid tension over cutting interest rates, and as Trump has pushed for steeper cuts, which received pushback from Fed Chair Jerome Powell and other top leaders at the central bank. Miran has called for rate cuts, and on Thursday said he expected rate cuts in December, according to reporting from \u003Ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/feds-miran-says-he-expects-rate-cut-december-2025-11-06/\">\u003Cspan class=\"s3\">Reuters\u003C/span>\u003C/a>.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. A Clearing Network Unifying Fragmented Blockchains","yellow-a-clearing-network-unifying-fragmented-blockchains",[],"2025-10-08T11:57:15-04:00","11:57AM EDT","October 8, 2025, 11:57AM Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellow connects different fragmented blockchains into a unified Layer3 clearing network, eliminating the need for constant bridging and reducing the latency of crosschain transactions.\u003C/span>\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The platform processes trades offchain through state channels, batching liability updates between counterparties and committing only net settlement results to the base chain for finality.\u003C/span>\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This architecture supports billions of messages per day, powering use cases such as highfrequency trading, crosschain payments, and realtime gaming interactions without overloading base networks.\u003C/span>\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Developers and enterprises can integrate Yellow to deliver seamless, lowcost crosschain functionality, accelerating the adoption of scalable blockchain applications.\u003C/span>\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>This research piece is unlocked by \u003Ca href=\"https://www.yellow.org/\">Yellow Network\u003C/a>\u003C/strong>\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","The DeFi landscape remains highly fragmented. Liquidity is siloed within isolated blockchains, and moving assets across them requires bridges that introduce latency, exorbitant fees, and significant counterparty risk. This fragmentation limits capital efficiency and undermines seamless user experiences. Meanwhile, high-frequency trading and micropayments are unviable on-chain. Blockspace constraints and gas fees make real-time interactions cost-prohibitive […]","\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The DeFi landscape remains highly fragmented. Liquidity is siloed within isolated blockchains, and moving assets across them requires bridges that introduce latency, exorbitant fees, and significant counterparty risk. This fragmentation limits capital efficiency and undermines seamless user experiences.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-373850 size-full\" src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/10/yellow-1-scaled.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"2560\" height=\"1340\" />\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Meanwhile, high-frequency trading and micropayments are unviable on-chain. Blockspace constraints and gas fees make real-time interactions cost-prohibitive and slow.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Whats missing in the digital assets space is a purpose-built clearing layer that can unify fragmented liquidity, enable transparent price discovery, and scale with demand.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>\u003Cstrong>Yellows Clearing Layer Approach\u003C/strong>\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cb>\u003Ci>Yellow\u003C/i>\u003C/b>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> addresses fragmentation by introducing a chain-agnostic clearing network that drastically reduces cross-chain friction and settlement delays. Instead of settling each transaction on-chain, Yellow batches off-chain trades and finalizes only the net outcomes.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This architecture supports billions of off-chain messages per day, offering throughput that far exceeds existing Layer-1 and Layer-2 networks.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">At its core, Yellow is a Layer-3 mesh network composed of state channels, designed to abstract away the underlying blockchains. It provides a unified virtual ledger where applications interact seamlessly across chains.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-373852 size-full\" src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/10/yellow-2b.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1523\" height=\"741\" />\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Developers no longer need to engineer around interoperability challenges. They can build directly on Yellow, focusing on product logic and user experience rather than infrastructure.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellows design draws inspiration from Bitcoins Lightning Network. Participants post collateral into smart contracts on supported blockchain networks and open high-speed state channels with other brokers. Within these channels, liabilities are updated off-chain at high frequency while maintaining synchronized virtual balances.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When liabilities become significant or at scheduled settlement times, channels are closed and net settlements are written back to the base layer using state channel contracts. This eliminates the bottlenecks of on-chain settlements while preserving security and enforcing transaction finality.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">By combining high-frequency off-chain updates with efficient net settlement, Yellow resolves two of DeFis most critical pain points: multi-chain fragmentation and cross-chain communication latency. This lays the groundwork for scalable, trust-minimized financial infrastructure across all chains.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>\u003Cstrong>Technical Framework\u003C/strong>\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">At the heart of Yellows architecture is \u003C/span>\u003Cb>\u003Ci>Nitrolite\u003C/i>\u003C/b>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, a modular framework built on the ERC7824 standard for off-chain state channels. Nitrolite enables users and brokers to conduct real-time trading by exchanging liabilities and updating positions off-chain, while retaining cryptographic guarantees of enforceability through smart contracts. This setup ensures that all activity remains verifiable and enforceable on-chain.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Each broker on Yellow operates a \u003C/span>\u003Cb>\u003Ci>ClearNode\u003C/i>\u003C/b>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, which provides a trustless execution layer that functions as the networks message hub and settlement engine. ClearNodes coordinate highfrequency liability updates across participants and enforce net settlements on multiple blockchains, forming the backbone of Yellows chain-agnostic clearing network.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>\u003Cstrong>Applications\u003C/strong>\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trading & Payments\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellows founding mission is to build a lightning-fast, off-chain clearing and settlement network for digital assets, serving as a crypto-native analogue to the Electronic Communication Networks (ECNs) in traditional securities markets.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">At the core of this vision is \u003C/span>\u003Cb>\u003Ci>NeoDAX\u003C/i>\u003C/b>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, Yellows modular brokerage infrastructure stack. It offers a streamlined setup experience and is designed for high scalability, capable of supporting hundreds of thousands of transactions per second. \u003C/span>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">NeoDAX combines the performance of centralized exchanges (CEXs) with the security principles of decentralized exchanges (DEXs).\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellows peer-to-peer liquidity aggregation system mitigates counterparty risk through a fully automated net settlement process. The network levies a small clearing fee, calculated as a percentage of the net settlement liability, which directly funds the Yellow treasury.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Additionally, \u003Cem>\u003Cstrong>Loculus, \u003C/strong>\u003C/em>a crypto-native AI terminal, integrates five core servicestrading, research, learning, narratives, and airdrop discoveryinto a single, personalized interface powered by the Yellow SDK. This architecture guarantees instant and gasless trade execution in a terminal that analyzes real-time market conditions to deliver personalized results.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Beyond exchange trading, Yellow facilitates cross-chain token transfers, which opens the door to broader applications, enabling near-instant, low-cost payments in contexts such as retail or live events.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">At the same time, Yellows role as a trustless, chain-agnostic clearing layer makes it more directly comparable to SWIFTs function in global financial markets, which is a neutral infrastructure layer that connects fragmented institutions and ensures secure, efficient settlement across borders. In the digital asset space, Yellow provides that same backbone for brokers and exchanges operating across multiple blockchains.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Enterprise Integration\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellows modular architecture allows enterprises to integrate crypto functionality gradually, adding components such as sign-in modules, custody contracts, trading interfaces, and admin panels directly into their existing Web2 products. This incremental approach reduces technical overhead and accelerates time-to-market for digital asset features. For example, \u003Cem>\u003Cstrong>Credit Swap\u003C/strong>\u003C/em> is a peer-to-peer platform that helps crypto holders qualify for traditional mortgages by connecting them to proxy buyers who can assist in securing conventional bank loans, with Yellows state channels managing high-speed auction and bidding to match users. \u003Cbr />\r\n\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Because Yellow is chain-agnostic, enterprises can support multiple blockchains without hassle. State channels abstract away the complexities of cross-chain settlement and collateral management, enabling seamless interaction across disparate networks.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For instance, a fintech or e-commerce company can integrate Yellow to offer asset trading or token-based payments within their existing services. A ticketing platform can embed a Yellow-compatible wallet to enable users to purchase event tickets and merchandise with digital assets from any supported blockchain. A good example of this is \u003Cem>\u003Cstrong>Beatwav\u003C/strong>\u003C/em>, an event-centric commerce platform that utilizes state channels to provide instant, gas-free payments for event purchases, offering near-instant settlement.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This benefits developers through plug-and-play modules that accelerate deployment, while users enjoy a frictionless, low-fee experience. The result is a significantly lower barrier to Web3 integration for traditional businesses looking to expand into the realm of digital assets.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>\u003Cstrong>Key Differentiators\u003C/strong>\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellows Layer-3 clearing network addresses liquidity fragmentation more effectively than bridges or single-chain DEX aggregators, by linking brokers and exchanges across multiple blockchains through state-channel infrastructure.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Because only the net outcome of trade batches is written to the base chain, Yellow achieves throughput on par with centralized exchanges, far exceeding what todays Layer-1 and Layer-2 blockchains can support.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Its chain-agnostic design contrasts with other interoperability solutions that require bespoke bridge infrastructure or custom chain adapters, allowing developers to build cross-chain products without dealing with low-level plumbing.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Its trustless model further distinguishes Yellow from legacy clearing houses, since collateral is locked in smart contracts rather than with centralized intermediaries, mitigating counterparty default risk and preserving user control.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Finally, regulatory alignment differentiates Yellow from most DeFi protocols by mirroring traditional capital market structures, separating custody, clearing, and execution, while still allowing KYC/AML enforcement at the network edge. This reduces compliance friction and simplifies licensing requirements across jurisdictions.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>\u003Cstrong>Adoption Drivers\u003C/strong>\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Several upcoming milestones could be critical in driving Yellows initial adoption.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In 2025, the team plans to deliver the first major release of the ClearNode technology stack, establishing the foundation for Yellows production-ready clearing infrastructure.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Following this, the roadmap includes expanding support for both EVM and nonEVM blockchains, introducing account-abstraction-enabled cross-chain swaps, and growing the brokerage ecosystem. Together, these steps will broaden protocol utility while reducing integration barriers for developers and partners.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yellow abstracts away the complexity of interoperability, enabling builders to easily integrate the Layer-3 network into their applications. Gaming studios, fintech platforms, and emerging DeFi apps can tap into Yellow without re-engineering their infrastructure, accelerating time-to-market and expanding the protocols network effects.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The introduction of the native protocol token, YELLOW, adds a powerful economic layer to the network. Transaction and clearing fees will be paid in YELLOW, and brokers must lock the token as collateral to open state channels. If a participant fails to settle within the pre-agreed period, their deposit can be slashed, creating strong incentives for honest behavior.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Institutional backing further strengthens Yellows position. A \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://yellow.com/news/ripples-chris-larsen-backs-dollar10m-seed-round-in-yellow-network-to-address-crypto-trading-challenges\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">$10 million\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> seed round led by Ripple cofounder Chris Larsen, with participation from Consensys Ventures and GSR Capital, signals strong industry confidence.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As traditional financial institutions deepen their investment in modern, blockchainbased clearing systems, Yellows trustless, scalable design aligns well with evolving infrastructure demands.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ultimately, the pace and scale of adoption will depend on execution and market receptivity. But with a solid technical roadmap, regulatory alignment, and strong capital backing, Yellow has the foundations to play an important role in emerging cross-chain financial infrastructure.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. to unify fragmented liquidity in DeFi, enabling seamless cross-blockchain transactions, reducing fees, and mitigating counterparty risk.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Utilizing off-chain state channels, Yellow accomplishes high-frequency trading and micropayments without the high costs associated with on-chain transactions, surpassing the capabilities of current Layer-1 and Layer-2 solutions.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Yellow’s architecture, inspired by Bitcoin’s Lightning Network, allows for the batching of off-chain trades with net settlements finalized on-chain, enhancing transaction efficiency while maintaining security.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Target applications of Yellow’s infrastructure include gaming, real-time trading, and payments, offering solutions like blockchain-agnostic NFTs and a modular brokerage infrastructure stack (NeoDAX) for high scalability.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Yellow differentiates itself by achieving high throughput akin to centralized exchanges through batched trade settlements and maintaining a trustless model with smart contract-collateralized state channels.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The roadmap for Yellow includes major releases to enhance its clearing infrastructure, introducing native protocol token YELLOW for economic incentives, and showcasing institutional support with a $10 million seed round led by Ripple’s co-founder.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n",{"name":617,"url":618,"id":619,"description":620},"Layer 2s and Scaling","https://www.theblock.co/category/layer-2s-and-scaling",54896,"\u003Cp>News and analysis href=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/09/20250902_Midnight_Report-1.pdf\">here\u003C/a>\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","Public blockchains have seen two fundamental structural barriers to widespread adoption. First, ideological tribalism has fragmented the ecosystem, splintering developer talent, liquidity, and community focus across competing “winner-take-all” networks rather than fostering collaborative innovation. This fragmentation has created an engineering tax that slows progress, with 2024 seeing the first net decline in new developer participation […]","\u003Cp>Public blockchains have seen two fundamental structural barriers to widespread adoption. First, ideological tribalism has fragmented the ecosystem, splintering developer talent, liquidity, and community focus across competing \"winner-take-all\" networks rather than fostering collaborative innovation. This fragmentation has created an engineering tax that slows progress, with 2024 seeing the first net decline in new developer participation since 2019. Secondly, the inherent transparency in public blockchains has deterred enterprise adoption, as organizations often cannot expose sensitive commercial data, supplier relationships, or transaction volumes to competitors and regulators through immutable public ledgers.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-369368 size-full\" src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/09/CHAIN-LAUNCHED.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"2456\" height=\"1342\" />\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The economic consequences of this fragmentation are substantial and measurable. Cross-chain bridge exploits have resulted in billions in losses, while the proliferation of Layer-1 and Layer-2 networks has scattered liquidity and forced developers to choose between ecosystems. However, market signals indicate a shift toward collaboration, with venture capital increasingly flowing toward multichain and privacy-focused projects. In 2024, funding for interoperability and privacy solutions grew 62% year-over-year, while multichain projects secured $780 million in funding, representing an 84% increase from the previous year.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-369370 size-full\" src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/09/LOSS-FROM-BRIDGE-scaled.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"2560\" height=\"1430\" />\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>This \u003Ca href=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/09/20250902_Midnight_Report-1.pdf\">report\u003C/a> examines how selective disclosure privacy combined with chain-agnostic design can resolve these adoption barriers, drawing parallels to the internet's evolution from fragmented networks to unified infrastructure through open standards and layered privacy protocols. Using Midnight's cooperative blockchain architecture as a case study, we explore how privacy-preserving interoperability can enable enterprises to leverage blockchain benefits while maintaining commercial confidentiality, potentially unlocking the industry's untapped addressable market through collaborative rather than competitive ecosystem development.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. This includes the \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/litecoin-etf-live-chart/340139/canary-litecoin-etf-ltcc\">Canary Litecoin ETF\u003C/a>, the first one to go live.\u003C/p>",[762,763,765],{"name":540,"slug":540,"taxonomy":146},{"name":764,"slug":764,"taxonomy":146},"litecoin",{"name":766,"slug":766,"taxonomy":146},"ltc",[768],{"ID":769,"name":770,"symbol":771,"thumbnail":772,"status":330,"url":773},248361,"Litecoin","LTC","https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2023/10/litecoin.png","https://www.theblock.co/price/248361/litecoin-ltc-usd",[],{"chart_visibility_checkbox":776,"chart-JSON-file-URL":777,"chart_analyst_score":580,"data_sources":778,"plotline_order":585,"chart_provider":586,"chart-category":780,"tblk-related-people":19,"tblk-related-tokens":781,"tblk-related-stocks":19,"tblk-related-etfs":793},[577,578],"https://data.tbstat.com/dashboard/markets_structuredproducts_ltcspotetfmarketshare_daily_yahoofinance.json",[779],{"source-text":583,"source-link":584},61064,[782],{"ID":769,"post_author":783,"post_date":784,"post_date_gmt":785,"post_content":786,"post_title":770,"post_excerpt":18,"post_status":330,"comment_status":787,"ping_status":787,"post_password":18,"post_name":764,"to_ping":18,"pinged":18,"post_modified":784,"post_modified_gmt":785,"post_content_filtered":18,"post_parent":788,"guid":789,"menu_order":788,"post_type":790,"post_mime_type":18,"comment_count":791,"filter":792},"4356","2023-10-23 13:32:17","2023-10-23 17:32:17","\u003Cp>Litecoin (LTC) is a decentralized digital currency that allows for fast and low-cost transactions, serving as a peer-to-peer cryptocurrency similar to Bitcoin. It was created by Charlie Lee, a former Google engineer, and aims to provide a more efficient alternative to traditional payment methods.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Unique features of Litecoin:\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Ch3>Faster transaction confirmation times\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>Litecoin stands out with its faster transaction confirmation times compared to other cryptocurrencies. Blocks are generated every 2.5 minutes in \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/231839/litecoin-futures-open-interest-jumps-ahead-of-upcoming-halving-event\">Litecoin\u003C/a>, compared to Bitcoin's 10-minute block generation time. This enables quicker confirmation and addition of transactions to the blockchain. The faster transaction confirmation times of Litecoin make it a more convenient and efficient cryptocurrency for everyday transactions. Users can perform transactions with quick settlement times, making it suitable for online shopping and peer-to-peer payments. This feature also improves Litecoin's scalability as it can handle more transactions within a given timeframe compared to cryptocurrencies with slower confirmation times. Overall, Litecoin's faster transaction confirmation times make it a practical choice for both merchants and individuals seeking a cryptocurrency that can support their daily transactions in a timely manner.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>Scrypt algorithm for mining\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>Litecoin uses the Scrypt algorithm for mining, as opposed to the commonly used SHA-256 algorithm. The Scrypt algorithm was specifically designed to be memory-intensive, requiring a significant amount of memory for mining operations. This choice was made to make mining more accessible to a wider range of users, eliminating the need for specialized and expensive hardware known as ASICs. By utilizing consumer-grade hardware like CPUs and GPUs, Litecoin mining becomes more decentralized and available to a larger audience. This inclusive approach allows individuals to participate in the mining process without the financial burden of investing in specialized equipment. It levels the playing field and encourages a diverse range of miners. Additionally, the Scrypt algorithm enhances the security of Litecoin by making it more resistant to ASIC mining. This reduces the risk of network centralization and increases the overall security of the blockchain.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch3>Segregated Witness implementation\u003C/h3>\r\n\u003Cp>One of its notable features is the implementation of Segregated Witness (SegWit), a protocol upgrade that changed transaction processing and recording on the blockchain. Unlike traditional blockchain systems, where transaction data and validation information were combined into a single block, SegWit separates witness data and stores it outside the main block. This separation significantly increases efficiency and allows for more transactions to be included in each block. As a result, transaction fees have been reduced, and confirmation speeds have improved.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>When was Litecoin created or founded?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Litecoin was founded in October 2011 by Charlie Lee, a former Google engineer. Lee envisioned Litecoin as a faster and lighter alternative to Bitcoin, aiming to address some of the scalability and transaction speed issues associated with its predecessor.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The group of developers who worked with Charlie Lee to create Litecoin remains relatively anonymous. However, their contributions to the development and maintenance of the cryptocurrency have been crucial. Litecoin has gained a significant following and has established itself as one of the leading cryptocurrencies in the market, thanks in part to the efforts of its founders and the development team.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Lee notably sold all of his Litecoin holdings in December 2017. This move was seen as controversial by some, as it was perceived as dumping on his own community near its all-time high price. Lee stated that he sold his holdings to avoid any accusations of insider trading and to focus on the development of Litecoin without any personal financial interests.\u003C/p>","closed",0,"https://www.theblock.co/token/litecoin","token","0","raw",[794],{"ID":795,"post_author":796,"post_date":797,"post_date_gmt":798,"post_content":799,"post_title":800,"post_excerpt":18,"post_status":330,"comment_status":787,"ping_status":787,"post_password":18,"post_name":801,"to_ping":18,"pinged":18,"post_modified":802,"post_modified_gmt":803,"post_content_filtered":18,"post_parent":788,"guid":804,"menu_order":788,"post_type":540,"post_mime_type":18,"comment_count":791,"filter":792},340139,"5056","2025-02-11 14:47:14","2025-02-11 19:47:14","\u003Cp>The Canary Litecoin ETF offers investors direct exposure to the price of Litecoin (LTC) through a regulated exchange-traded fund structure. The fund, issued by Canary Capital, holds Litecoin physically within a trust and trades on the U.S. markets under the ticker symbol LTCC. The listing follows a completed S-1 registration and the requisite 19b-4 filing by the exchange, marking regulatory clearance and full product availability.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Approved alongside other altcoin-based ETFs, the Canary Litecoin ETF enters the market under the framework set by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for spot cryptocurrency funds. Its administration and custody infrastructure are managed through partnerships with trusted service providersU.S. Bancorp Fund Services, Coinbase Custody Trust Company LLC, and BitGoensuring compliance with institutional-grade standards. With the launch of this fund, investors now have a streamlined and regulated vehicle for obtaining Litecoin exposure via traditional brokerage accounts.\u003C/p>","Canary Litecoin ETF","canary-litecoin-etf","2025-11-04 17:09:15","2025-11-04 22:09:15","https://www.theblock.co/uncategorized-etf-live-chart/340139/",{"id":806,"url":807,"type":499,"title":808,"slug":809,"categories":810,"thumbnail":813,"lastUpdated":814,"lastUpdatedMid":175,"thumbnailCredit":18,"thumbnailCaption":18,"body":815,"tags":816,"relatedTokens":819,"relatedIndices":821,"customFields":822,"hasAnomaly":19,"anomalyDescription":18},377733,"https://www.theblock.co/data/etfs/crypto-etfs/cumulative-spot-litecoin-etf-volumes","Cumulative Spot Litecoin ETF Volumes","cumulative-spot-litecoin-etf-volumes",[811,812],{"name":504,"slug":505,"taxonomy":506},{"name":756,"slug":757,"taxonomy":506},"https://data.tbstat.com/dashboard-images/cumulative-spot-litecoin-etf-volumes.png","2025-11-05 03:28:46","\u003Cp>The daily cumulative volume (in USD) for spot \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/litecoin-etf-live-chart\">LitecoinETFs\u003C/a>. is Berachain?","what-is-berachain","2025-04-04T05:17:51-04:00","5:17AM EDT","April 4, 2025, 5:17AM EDT","04/04/25","Apr 04, 2025","by \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/author/mk-manoylov\">MK Manoylov\u003C/a>",[845],{"id":846,"name":847,"thumbnail":848,"url":849,"slug":850,"description":851,"isGuestAuthor":19,"meta":852},1836,"MK
