Block.",{"twitter":18,"linkedin":18,"email":18,"telegram":18},[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/03/20250306_BeraChain_News_2-1200x675.jpg","Understanding the Layer 1 blockchain Berachain, its proof-of-liquidity consensus mechanism and its multi-token model featuring BERA and BGT. ","\u003Cp>Berachain is a Layer 1 blockchain undergirded by a proof-of-liquidity consensus mechanism and known for its tri-token ecosystem. It's built on the Cosmos SDK and maintains an identical execution layer with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Berachains proof-of-liquidity also differentiates it from other blockchains by separating which token validates nodes and which one is used for governance in its consensus mechanism. Berachain launched its \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/338765/berachain-mainnet\">mainnet\u003C/a> on Feb. 6, 2025.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>How does Berachain work?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Proof-of-liquidity\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>You may have heard of \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/271536/what-difference-proof-of-work-pow-proof-of-stake-pos\">proof-of-work\u003C/a> or \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/271529/how-does-staking-work-and-where-does-the-yield-come-from\">proof-of-stake\u003C/a> consensus mechanisms to make blockchains \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/271528/what-consensus-mechanism\">secure\u003C/a> while keeping them decentralized. However, Berachain's consensus mechanism involves \"proof-of-liquidity,\" in which validators must lock up a portion of their liquidity to participate in securing the blockchain and validating transactions.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Proof-of-liquidity differs from proof-of-stake, though Berachain has \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.berachain.com/learn/what-is-proof-of-liquidity\">said\u003C/a> in its core docs that the former borrows from the latter. In proof-of-stake, a user locks up, or \"stakes,\" the blockchain's native token to secure the chain. The staker then receives that same token as a reward, which they can use for governance purposes in the blockchain later on.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Berachain's proof-of-liquidity \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.berachain.com/learn/pol/\">splits up\u003C/a> that model by using a token solely for chain security (BERA) and a token solely for governance and economic incentives (BGT). Users can only earn BGT by staking in reward vaults, a smart contract system that accumulates and distributes rewards to validators and liquidity providers participating in the network.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>However, you need a certain amount of BERA to become a validator. As Berachain \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.berachain.com/learn/pol/faqs\">explains\u003C/a> in its core docs: \"There is a minimum floor of 250,000 BERA required to be a validator. There is a maximum cap of 10,000,000 BERA for any validator's stake. Only the top 69 validators (ordered by BERA staked) can be in the active validator set. Even if someone stakes above the minimum 250,000 BERA, they would still need to have enough stake to be within the top 69 validators to be part of the active validator set that can produce blocks.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Tri-token ecosystem\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Berachain's primary token ecosystem includes BERA, BGT (\u003Ca href=\"https://docs.berachain.com/learn/pol/tokens/bgt\">Bera Governance Token\u003C/a>) and HONEY.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>BGT gives holders voting rights to participate in decision-making processes, such as protocol upgrades. Individuals can also use their BGT to \"boost\" a validator \"to receive incentives from that validator, based on the validator's commission rate and ability to convert their BGT block rewards to application incentives,\" according to Berachain's whitepaper.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>BERA is the utility token used for transaction fees, staking and interacting with the ecosystems services. It acts as a medium for exchange within the Berachain network, facilitating the functioning of dApps and ensuring that the network's operations are secure and efficient.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>While BGT and HONEY support Berachain's proof-of-liquidity, the Layer 1 also has a stablecoin called \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.berachain.com/learn/pol/tokens/honey\">HONEY\u003C/a>. Users can deposit approved collateral into a vault and mint HONEY against that collateral through the dApp HoneySwap, according to core development documents. HONEY can be used for payments or other purposes within the Berachain DeFi ecosystem.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Cosmos and EVM-compatibility\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Berachain is built on the Cosmos software development kit (SDK), a tool set for developers to build applications within the \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/249525/what-is-cosmos-and-how-does-it-work-a-beginners-guide-to-atom-cryptocurrency\">Cosmos\u003C/a> ecosystem.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Additionally, Berachain has an \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.berachain.com/learn/#berachain-evm-identical-%E2%9F%A0\">identical\u003C/a> execution layer with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/245720/what-are-evm-compatible-blockchains\">EVM\u003C/a>)  a decentralized computing environment that executes smart contracts and processes transactions on the Ethereum blockchain. It serves as the runtime environment for executing smart contracts written in Ethereum's programming language Solidity. Whenever the EVM upgrades, Berachain can immediately adopt it.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Berachain ecosystem\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Though Berachain is a relatively new Layer 1 compared to more entrenched networks such as \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/249527/what-is-ethereum-and-how-does-it-work-a-beginners-guide-to-eth-cryptocurrency\">Ethereum\u003C/a> and \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/249535/what-is-solana-and-how-does-it-work-a-beginners-guide-to-sol-cryptocurrency\">Solana\u003C/a>, the bear-themed blockchain has seen a proliferation of protocols built on top of it.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://hub.berachain.com/\">BeraHub\u003C/a> is a Berachain dApp that allows users to participate in the blockchain's nitty-gritty details, such as reviewing active validators, participating in governance and redeeming BGT for BERA.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>BeraHub also gives users access to Berachain's native decentralized exchange BEX.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>There's also the decentralized application HoneySwap for transacting with Berachain's stablecoin HONEY.And, of course, Berachain has its own blockchain explorer called \u003Ca href=\"https://berascan.com/\">Berascan\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Other projects built on Berachain include the liquid staking protocol \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/344455/berachain-infrared-series-a-token-round\">Infrared Finance\u003C/a> and the social finance platform Honey Chat.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Who's behind Berachain?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>The team behind the Layer 1 blockchain Berachain is a group of pseudonymous co-founders known as Homme Bera, Dev Bear, Papa Bear and Smokey the Bera. However, the Berachain team has expanded to include individuals with prior experience at projects such as Sui, Polygon, Mantle, Coinbase, Chainlink, and Aave. For instance, former Polygon Labs lead \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/294060/former-polygon-head-defi-jack-melnick-joins-berachain\">Jack Melnick\u003C/a> joined Berachain as its head of DeFi.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>There's also the Berachain Foundation, an organization looking after Berachain's ecosystem and growth, which decides on \u003Ca href=\"https://blog.berachain.com/blog/berachain-airdrop-overview\">token allocations\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The team behind Berachain raised\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/227344/berachain-funding-new-layer-1-blockchain\">$42 million\u003C/a> in funding in April 2023, as well as \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/288066/layer-1-blockchain-developer-berachain-raises-100-million-in-series-b-funding\">$100 million\u003C/a> in Series B financing one year later.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> 2025 The Block. All Rights Reserved. This article is provided for informational purposes only. 1","layer-1","tblk-learn",{"id":877,"url":878,"type":835,"title":879,"slug":880,"label":120,"priority":109,"published":881,"publishTimestamp":882,"publishedFormatted":883,"publishedFormattedShort":884,"publishedFormattedMid":885,"modified":886,"modifiedFormatted":887,"modifiedFormattedShort":884,"modifiedFormattedMid":885,"byLines":843,"authors":888,"editors":891,"thumbnail":892,"thumbnailCredit":192,"thumbnailCaption":18,"intro":18,"excerpt":893,"body":894,"aiSummaryEnabled":19,"aiSummary":18,"primaryCategory":895,"categories":896,"tags":898,"relatedTokens":899,"relatedETFs":900,"relatedStocks":901,"relatedPeople":902,"relatedIndices":908,"userHasAccess":5,"isSponsored":19,"isAccess":19,"isFeature":19,"sponsor":120,"wordCount":909,"readingTime":223,"customFields":910,"isProNews":19,"tbcoPublished":881,"tbcoPublishTimestamp":882,"tbcoPublishedFormatted":883,"tbcoPublishedFormattedShort":884,"tbcoPublishedFormattedMid":885,"isResearchUnlock":19,"isReport":19,"verticalImage":18,"difficulty":869,"learnCategories":911},346005,"https://www.theblock.co/learn/346005/what-is-monad","What is Monad?","what-is-monad","2025-03-17T08:46:42-04:00","8:46AM EDT","March 17, 2025, 8:46AM EDT","03/17/25","Mar 17, 2025","2025-03-17T08:52:24-04:00","March 17, 2025, 8:52AM EDT",[889],{"id":846,"name":847,"thumbnail":848,"url":849,"slug":850,"description":851,"isGuestAuthor":19,"meta":890},{"twitter":18,"linkedin":18,"email":18,"telegram":18},[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2024/07/20240725_Monad_News_2-1200x675.jpg","Understanding the Layer 1 blockchain Monad, known for its EVM-compatibility and high throughput. ","\u003Cp>Monad is a Layer 1 network built by Monad Lab that's currently in its testnet phase with a mainnet launch on the way.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The upcoming network is widely anticipated because of its design that lets it process as many as 10,000 transactions per second. This is made possible through its four key optimizations: MonadBFT, asynchronous execution, parallel execution and MonadDb.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Monad is also compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/245720/what-are-evm-compatible-blockchains\">EVM\u003C/a>), a decentralized computing environment that executes smart contracts built on the Ethereum blockchain. This allows developers to more easily port over Ethereum applications to the Monad network.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>How does Monad work?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Monad \u003Ca href=\"https://www.monad.xyz/technology\">touts\u003C/a> itself as 1,000 times faster than Ethereum, with gas fees below $0.01 and low hardware requirements. Along with its 10,000 TPS throughput, Monad achieves one-second block times and single-slot finality. Put another way, Monad can process and confirm a new set of transactions once every second, and it immediately finalizes a \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/245697/what-are-blocks-in-a-blockchain\">block\u003C/a>added to its \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/249522/what-is-blockchain-technology-a-beginners-guide-to-a-distributed-ledger\">blockchain\u003C/a> to improve confirmation times.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Parallel and asynchronous execution\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Monad achieves its high performance benchmarks through \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.monad.xyz/monad-arch/execution/parallel-execution\">parallel execution\u003C/a> and \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.monad.xyz/monad-arch/consensus/asynchronous-execution\">asynchronous execution\u003C/a>. The former allows multiple transactions to be processed simultaneously, while the latterseparates the consensus and execution phases for greater efficiency.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>In most blockchains, transactions are processed sequentially so that each transaction is handled one at a time. This can bottleneck how many transactions the network handles. Monad's parallel execution and asynchronous execution reduce latency and increase the network's overall transaction capacity.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>These two key traits are based on what's supporting Monad  its consensus mechanism.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Monad's consensus mechanism\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>At the core of Monad is \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.monad.xyz/monad-arch/consensus/monad-bft\">MonadBFT\u003C/a>. It is a Byzantine Fault Tolerant protocol based on the HotStuff framework. MonadBFT facilitates the network's one-second finality by reducing the number of communication phases required between validators, thus streamlining the process of agreeing on the next block.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Additionally, MonadBFT integrates deferred execution to separate the consensus and execution phases. Validators first agree on the transaction order (consensus) before executing them. This approach optimizes resource usage and allows for parallel execution of transactions.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Monad still uses a \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/271536/what-difference-proof-of-work-pow-proof-of-stake-pos\">proof-of-stake\u003C/a> consensus mechanism to guard against Sybil attacks. Proof of stake selects validators based on the amount of cryptocurrency they stake to establish decentralization, while MonadBFT deploys the Byzantine Fault Tolerant approach to enable the one-second single-slot finality.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>MonadDb\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Monad also contains \u003Ca href=\"https://docs.monad.xyz/monad-arch/execution/monaddb\">MonadDb\u003C/a>, a distributed database that undergirds its Ethereum compatibility.MonadDb deploys a distributed architecture to spread large amounts of data across multiple nodes, ensuring data remains accessible in the event of node failures or network partitions.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Monads ecosystem and use cases\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Notable protocols in Monad's ecosystem include:\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/307499/monad-liquid-staking-platform-apriori-100-million-token-valuation-funding\">aPriori\u003C/a>:\u003C/strong> aPriori is a project that initially focused on developing a maximal extractable value (\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/245701/what-is-maximal-extractable-value-mev\">MEV\u003C/a>) solution for the EVM blockchains. However, it later \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/307499/monad-liquid-staking-platform-apriori-100-million-token-valuation-funding\">shifted\u003C/a> its sights to the Monad ecosystem.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/307487/brevan-howard-digital-monad-liquid-staking-protocol-kintsu-funding\">\u003Cstrong>Kintsu\u003C/strong>\u003C/a>: A \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/280439/what-is-liquid-staking-and-why-does-it-matter\">liquid staking\u003C/a> protocol, in which users can stake their tokens while maintaining liquidity.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/307488/monad-on-chain-orderbook-exchange-kuru-raises-seed-funding\">Kuru\u003C/a>\u003C/strong>: An onchain order book exchange built on Monad.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Cp>Monad is one of a small sector of blockchains to offer scalability without rollups, Layer 2 scaling \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/251458/what-are-the-advantages-and-disadvantages-of-layer-2-scaling-solutions\">solutions\u003C/a> that process transactions off-chain and batch them to the Layer 1. It has \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.pro/research/layer-by-layer-parallelized-execution-in-the-evm-with-monad-278294\">gained popularity\u003C/a> alongside Solana, Sui, Aptos, and Sei.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"What's particularly interesting about Monad is that it draws significant inspiration from \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/308506/what-is-aptos\">Aptos\u003C/a> and \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/215292/inside-the-sui-ecosystem-with-mysten-labs-ceo-evan-cheng\">Sui\u003C/a> in designing its parallelized execution environment, while still maintaining compatibility with EVM,\" Manifold Ventures General Partner Aric Chang \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/307927/the-funding-monad-ecosystem-crypto-vc-interest\">told\u003C/a> The Block.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>More developers might opt to build projects previously only seen on Solana such as high-fidelity DeFi and decentralized physical infrastructure networks (DePINs) due to its high throughput and EVM compatibility, Pantera Capital General Partner Lauren Stephanian added.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Who makes up the team behind Monad?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>The team behind Monad consists of \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/253210/monad-founder\">Keone Hon\u003C/a>, James Hunsaker and Eunice Giarta. They are the core founding team behind Monad Labs, a blockchain development company that is the principal builder behind the Monad blockchain.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Hon and Hunsaker previously worked for Jump Trading, where they built low-latency, high-frequency trading systems. Eunice Giarta serves as Monad Labs' chief operating officer.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Hon and Hunsaker had raised \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/211352/monad-labs-funding-blockchain-former-jump-trading-developers\">$19 million\u003C/a> in funding in February 2023, followed by \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/287257/monad-labs-raises-225-million-in-funding-round-led-by-paradigm\">$225 million\u003C/a> led by Paradigm more than a year later.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Beyond Monad Labs, the \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/331068/monad-foundation-forms-to-promote-adoption-of-the-ethereum-compatible-layer-1\">Monad Foundation\u003C/a> acts as an independent organization that promotes and develops the Monad blockchain. Its primary focus is to support the Monad blockchain's progress toward its mainnet launch (Monad rolled out its \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/341436/monad-to-roll-out-a-public-testnet-on-feb-19\">public testnet\u003C/a> in mid-February of 2025.)\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>In addition, the Foundation encourages community-led improvement proposals, provides developer documentation and engages in ecosystem development for the Monad protocol.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> 2025 The Block. All Rights Reserved. This article is provided for informational purposes only. is decentralized science (DeSci)?","what-is-decentralized-science-desci","2025-03-05T16:00:23-05:00","4:00PM EST","March 5, 2025, 4:00PM EST","03/05/25","Mar 05, 2025",[924],{"id":846,"name":847,"thumbnail":848,"url":849,"slug":850,"description":851,"isGuestAuthor":19,"meta":925},{"twitter":18,"linkedin":18,"email":18,"telegram":18},[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2022/06/2022062_Hiring_Roundup-1200x675.jpg","\u003Cspan class=\"acf-media-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblockcrypto.com/\" target=\"_blank\">The Block\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>","Understanding the benefits and drawbacks to decentralized science (DeSci) introducing web3 technology to the scientific process.","\u003Cdiv id=\"1740771550.906149\" class=\"c-virtual_list__item\" tabindex=\"0\" role=\"listitem\" aria-setsize=\"-1\" data-qa=\"virtual-list-item\" data-item-key=\"1740771550.906149\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__background p-message_pane_message__message c-message_kit__message\" role=\"presentation\" data-qa=\"message_container\" data-qa-unprocessed=\"false\" data-qa-placeholder=\"false\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__hover\" role=\"document\" aria-roledescription=\"message\" data-qa-hover=\"true\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__actions c-message_kit__actions--default\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__gutter\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__gutter__right\" role=\"presentation\" data-qa=\"message_content\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__blocks c-message_kit__blocks--rich_text\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"c-message__message_blocks c-message__message_blocks--rich_text\" data-qa=\"message-text\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"p-block_kit_renderer\" data-qa=\"block-kit-renderer\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper--first\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"p-rich_text_block\" dir=\"auto\">\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"p-rich_text_section\">Decentralized science, or \"DeSci,\" is the use of web3 infrastructure in the scientific process. It aims to make scientific work more transparent, accessible and collaborative by placing data onchain or funding research pursuits with cryptocurrency.\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003Cp>However, DeSci comes with risks. Low-quality research can slip through to publication. In addition, it's unclear where decentralized science stands within existing regulatory frameworks.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>This article explores what decentralized science is  along with its potential drawbacks.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>How does DeSci work?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"message-bubble__markdown font-label12\" data-v-c686a026=\"\">\r\n\u003Cp>Decentralized science is an emerging field in the web3 industry that focuses on how science is funded, conducted and shared. Though many of its use cases are still unexplored, DeSci frequently enables crowdfunding through decentralized autonomous organizations (\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/286323/what-is-a-decentralized-autonomous-organizations-dao\">DAOs\u003C/a>) and augments scientific data storage and dissemination through \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/249522/what-is-blockchain-technology-a-beginners-guide-to-a-distributed-ledger\">blockchains\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Regarding traditional life sciences and biotechnology in particular, DeSci gained popularity as a solution for lengthy funding processes and lack of transparency in intellectual property (IP) allocation. By promoting global resource collaboration and the sharing of all research data, including unsuccessful attempts, DeSci in these fields aims to create a more efficient scientific research system.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003C/div>\r\n\u003Ch2>Examples of DeSci projects\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>BIO Protocol is one of the biggest DeSci platforms, and it provides tools for funding, developing and governing scientific IP to accelerate the commercialization of biotech research. It's \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/325185/binance-labs-desci-investment-bio-protocol\">backed by YZi Labs\u003C/a>, formerly Binance Labs.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>BIO Protocol uses DAOs to crowdfund and decentralize the ownership of novel biotechnology and new drugs. These DAOs are known as decentralized biotechnology organizations and called \"BioDAOs.\" Their goal is to broaden the range of people investing in scientific startups and allowing them to potentially see benefits from successful developments  as BioDAOs tokenize and trade scientific research outcomes as tradable IP assets. BIO token holders can also get involved in decisions over funding and development directions.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Other DeSci firms use DAOs to fund scientific research as well, such as Molecule and its associated entity \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/206552/pfizer-ventures-backs-decentralized-science-startup-in-4-1-million-round\">VitaDAO\u003C/a>. Molecule is a marketplace for researchers to list projects that are non-fungible tokens (\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/251483/what-is-a-nft-and-why-do-they-have-value\">NFTs\u003C/a>) intended to signal intellectual property. Current projects on the platform include a Newcastle University study into molecular aging and a University of Copenhagen project into longevity. These projects receive funding via DAOs, usually in a stablecoin such as USDCoin (\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/251863/what-is-usdc-and-how-does-it-work-a-guide-to-circles-stablecoin\">USDC\u003C/a>).\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp data-v-cb736f2c=\"\">\"The broader vision is to create a DeSci ecosystem that won't just consist of DAOs funding research but also hopefully pharmaceutical companies along with the general public investing into these research projects,\" said \u003Cspan data-v-cb736f2c=\"\">founder Tyler Golato\u003C/span> in an \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/151539/decentralized-science-platform-molecule-raises-13-million-in-seed-funding\">interview\u003C/a> with The Block.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Beyond crowdfunding, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/318158/a16z-makes-first-desci-investment-in-decentralized-biobank-platform-aminochain\">AminoChain\u003C/a> deploys blockchain technology in an attempt to create private yet secure information channels for scientific data. The firm builds a Layer 2 that allows medical institutions to relay health data while protecting patient privacy.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>What are the advantages of DeSci?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>DeSci has a number of potential advantages over the traditional scientific process, including but not limited to:\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Opening scientific access:\u003C/strong> Decentralized technology opens up research and data for everyone by placing it on a public, immutable network. This can facilitate the \u003Ca href=\"https://ntrs.nasa.gov/citations/20230009029\">transparency\u003C/a> and traceability of scientific research.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Crowdsourcing:\u003C/strong> DeSci encourages open collaboration across the globe. Researchers, students and hobbyists alike can share data and validate each others work. In this respect, DeSci is a web3 version of \"\u003Ca href=\"https://www.citizenscience.gov/#\">Citizen Science\u003C/a>,\" in which members of the public can contribute data for scientific projects.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Funding and incentives:\u003C/strong> Traditional funding models, like government grants or corporate sponsorship, can be bypassed through decentralized \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/325185/binance-labs-desci-investment-bio-protocol\">financing\u003C/a> mechanisms. \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/206552/pfizer-ventures-backs-decentralized-science-startup-in-4-1-million-round\">Crowdfunding\u003C/a> through token-based incentives lets researchers raise funds directly from the public or other interested parties. Additionally, token rewards may be offered to incentivize reproducible scientific results.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Ch2>What are the potential drawbacks of DeSci?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>In decentralized systems, especially those lacking robust peer-review mechanisms, incorrect or incomplete data could proliferate. Thus, DeSci may allow low-quality research to be published.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Cryptocurrency can bolster scientific funding, but volatile tokens may prevent the long-term viability of extended research endeavors. And much like crypto, funding within decentralized science exists in a regulatory grey area  especially if they \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/173171/a-crypto-lawyer-dissects-the-impact-of-the-cftc-targeting-daos\">employ\u003C/a> DAOs.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>DeSci is still a burgeoning industry, and many firms within it are early-stage. They can succumb to the same circumstances that cause other fledgling firms to fail, such as ineffective cash management or struggling to create a viable product, which hinders the overall evolution of decentralized science.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> 2025 The Block. is blockchain abstraction?","what-is-blockchain-abstraction","2024-09-01T07:48:02-04:00","7:48AM EDT","September 1, 2024, 7:48AM EDT","09/01/24","Sep 01, 2024","by \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/author/jordan-leech\">Jordan Leech\u003C/a>",[960],{"id":961,"name":962,"thumbnail":963,"url":964,"slug":965,"description":966,"isGuestAuthor":19,"meta":967},8708,"Jordan Leech","https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2024/05/Jordan-Leech-300x300.jpg","https://www.theblock.co/author/jordan-leech","jordan-leech","Jordan Leech is a podcast producer at The Block. He has worked for several years as a broadcast journalist, camera operator, and producer before aiming to get established working in the crypto industry. Jordan holds a degree in Philosophy and Political Science from the University of Guelph and is an avid photographer and traveller in his free time.",{"twitter":968,"linkedin":18,"email":18,"telegram":18},"https://x.com/JordanML_",[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2022/12/20221227_Blockchain-Web3-Developer-Development-1-1200x675.jpg","\u003Cspan class=\"acf-media-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Ca href=\"https://theblock.co\" target=\"_blank\">The Block\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>","Blockchain abstraction refers to the simplification of the end-user experience by separating it from the complex underlying technology.","\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Blockchain, or simply chain abstraction, has become a prominent web3 topic as developers, users and enthusiasts seek ways to onboard new users and broaden the scope of the overall crypto ecosystem. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Blockchain abstraction refers to simplifying blockchain technologys end-user experience by separating it from the blockchains complex underlying technology while maintaining its core benefits. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This makes it easier for users and developers to interact with blockchain applications without needing deep technical knowledge.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Why is chain abstraction needed?\u003C/span>\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Despite improvements in the usability of various blockchain applications over the years, certain technical complexities still often persist that can prove challenging for average users. Users new to blockchain might be used to simply using U.S. dollars or their credit card to make whichever purchases they please, but once they attempt to buy an NFT for the first time, they may discover they do not have assets on the right blockchain, and thus cannot make the purchase. Or perhaps they attempt to send USDT to their wallet but select the wrong network and lose the funds. While these actions may seem straightforward to an experienced crypto native user, for new users it can be clunky and confusing.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Blockchain abstraction seeks to rectify this by increasing the usability and interoperability of various blockchain networks. Interoperability refers to the ability of different blockchain systems to communicate, share data and work together seamlessly. This means that assets can be transferred between different blockchain networks without intermediaries. Building applications with more inherent interoperability would spare the user the need to bridge between chains, allowing them more direct access to DeFi protocols or NFT markets.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Just as the internet became widely adopted when it abstracted the complexities of HTTP and TCP/IP, or computers in general with Windows and Apple operating systems, blockchain needs to do the same to reach mainstream users. By providing familiar user experiences, like simple sign-ins and one-click interactions, blockchain abstraction aims to replicate the usability of popular web2 applications.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What are some examples of chain abstraction?\u003C/span>\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">User-friendly interfaces are an example of blockchain abstraction. Wallets like \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/305318/what-is-metamask#:~:text=12%3A00PM%20EDT-,The%20Block,popular%20and%20most%20recognizable%20wallets.\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">MetaMask\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> or \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/305135/what-is-the-phantom-wallet\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Phantom\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> simplify the process of managing private keys and making transactions. Instead of dealing with cryptographic details, users can send and receive cryptocurrencies through more intuitive interfaces similar to online banking apps. MetaMask, for instance, allows users to interact with the Ethereum blockchain directly from their web browsers, making blockchain technology accessible to anyone familiar with using a browser extension.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">These wallets have also rolled out features over the years to allow users more options, such as in-app bridging or swapping, removing the need to find and connect to an external bridge to transfer assets between blockchains.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/307610/what-is-near-protocol\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">NEAR protocol\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is Layer 1 blockchain that has implemented certain aspects of blockchain abstraction, and it is an \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/285565/chain-abstraction-near-protocol\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">important goal of its founders\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> as it can lower the barrier to entry for users. One method is by using human-readable accounts, allowing interactions using names instead of complex wallet addresses.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Middleware solutions like Chainlink provide another layer of abstraction by connecting blockchain smart contracts with external data sources. This is crucial for applications that rely on real-world data, such as DeFi platforms. Chainlinks decentralized oracle network fetches data from various sources and feeds it into smart contracts, abstracting the complex process of integrating external data with blockchain applications.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Account abstraction on Ethereum\u003C/span>\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ethereum founder \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/297877/who-is-vitalik-buterin#:~:text=Vitalik%20Buterin%20is%20a%20Russian,known%20for%20co%2Dfounding%20Ethereum.\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Vitalik Buterin\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> has also commented on account abstraction, \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/284908/vitalik-buterin-account-abstraction\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">saying\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> that account abstraction is the way to provide security and convenience for blockchain developers and users while speaking at a conference in South Korea. Ethereums account abstraction standard, also known as ERC-4337, aims to enable user wallets to work as smart contracts without having to manage externally owned accounts and their private keys. ERC-4337 allows for more advanced features such as multi-signature wallets, social recovery mechanisms, and custom validation rules directly within user accounts. By shifting validation logic from the core protocol to the account level, users can implement personalized security measures, potentially making their accounts more resilient to unauthorized access and potential breaches.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">ERC-4337 could have substantial benefits for users. For instance, users can enjoy more flexible and secure ways to manage their accounts through features like multi-signature authentication, where multiple private keys are required to authorize transactions, significantly reducing the risk of hacks. Additionally, social recovery options allow users to regain access to their accounts through trusted contacts, mitigating the impact of lost private keys. Furthermore, ERC-4337 facilitates gas fee abstraction, which would allow users to pay transaction fees with tokens other than Ether or even have third parties sponsor their fees for them.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> 2025 The Block. is Trust wallet?","what-is-trust-wallet","2024-09-01T07:13:03-04:00","7:13AM EDT","September 1, 2024, 7:13AM EDT",[1000],{"id":961,"name":962,"thumbnail":963,"url":964,"slug":965,"description":966,"isGuestAuthor":19,"meta":1001},{"twitter":968,"linkedin":18,"email":18,"telegram":18},[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2024/08/Screenshot-2024-08-29-at-13.09.51-1200x669.png","Trust Wallet is a non-custodial cryptocurrency wallet available as both a mobile application and browser extension.","\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trust Wallet is a non-custodial cryptocurrency wallet that allows users to store, manage and engage with various digital assets. It supports numerous cryptocurrencies, including popular ones like bitcoin, ether, ERC-20 tokens, Solana and nonfungible tokens. \u003C/span>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It is available as a mobile app on Android and iOS platforms and as a browser extension.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>History and development of Trust Wallet\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trust Wallet was \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://trustwallet.com/blog/what-is-trust-wallet\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">founded\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> in 2017 by Ukrainian software developer Viktor Radchenko. Radchenko \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210528073229/https://trustwallet.com/blog/trustwallet-founder-viktor-radchenko-motivation\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">explained\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> in an interview that his motivations for building the wallet were to make crypto more accessible and that he wanted a way to store his tokens on his phone. The first version of Trust Wallet was released just two weeks after he began.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Initially, Trust Wallet was designed as a simple wallet for storing ERC-20 and ERC-223 tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. However, as the cryptocurrency market expanded and diversified, so did its functionality, which grew to support additional blockchains and their tokens, such as Solana.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In July 2018, Trust Wallet was \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.binance.com/en/support/announcement/binance-acquires-trust-wallet-a-secure-mobile-crypto-wallet-360010790652\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">acquired\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> by \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/296024/what-is-binance\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Binance\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, one of the worlds largest cryptocurrency exchanges, making the wallet the official on-chain wallet for the exchange. The acquisition enabled Trust Wallet to integrate with Binance's ecosystem and provided Binance users with an on-chain mobile wallet. Since the acquisition, Trust Wallet has continued to develop, adding support for multiple blockchains, decentralized applications and staking features.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In 2022, Radchenko \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://community.trustwallet.com/t/viktor-radchenko-to-stand-down-as-trust-wallet-ceo/441099\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">stepped\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> down as CEO of Trust Wallet to focus on his family and was replaced by \u003C/span>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Eowyn Chen, former Marketing Vice President at Binance.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://cointelegraph.com/news/binance-self-custody-wallet-launches-crypto-to-fiat-off-ramp\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">2023\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, Trust Wallet partnered with Moonpay and Ramp to provide users with fiat off and on ramps, allowing the conversion to fiat directly within the app.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Features and functions\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trust Wallet offers several features and functions that make it a versatile tool for managing digital assets. Trust Wallet claims to \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://trustwallet.com/blog/what-is-trust-wallet\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">support\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> over 10 million tokens from over 100 blockchains, making it one of the most comprehensive wallets available.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In addition to basic wallet features like sending, receiving, and storing digital assets, the app's integration with various decentralized exchanges allows users to trade and swap cryptocurrencies directly within the app.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trust Wallet also includes a built-in Dapp browser, which allows users to interact with decentralized applications directly from their wallet. This is particularly useful for participating in decentralized finance DeFi activities.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Additionally, Trust Wallet allows users to stake certain cryptocurrencies directly from their wallet, earning rewards as additional tokens. The wallet also supports the storage and management of NFTs. Through its integrations with Moonpay and Ramp, Trust Wallet also supports purchases of crypto with fiat directly within the app.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In terms of security features, the app offers biometric authentication and an in-built \u003C/span>\u003Ca href=\"https://trustwallet.com/blog/a-safer-web3-experience-with-trust-wallet-security-scanner\">\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">security scanner\u003C/span>\u003C/a>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, which provides warnings about potentially risky transactions to help protect users from scams.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Whats needed to set up a Trust Wallet account?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Setting up a Trust Wallet account is a straightforward process. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">First, users need to download the app, which is free on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store, or download the browser extension. \u003C/span>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After installing the app on their chosen device, users can follow the prompts to create a new wallet. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trust Wallet will then generate a 12-word recovery phrase, which users must securely store, as it is the only way to recover their wallet if they lose access to their device. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After creating the wallet, users can enhance security by enabling biometric authentication (fingerprint or facial recognition) and setting a passcode. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Once the wallet is set up, users can add cryptocurrencies by purchasing them through the app, receiving them from another wallet, or transferring them from an exchange.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>What is Trust Wallet Token?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trust Wallet Token was launched in 2020 and serves as the native utility token within the Trust Wallet ecosystem. TWT holders can participate in governance decisions, influencing the platform's future by voting on matters such as which blockchains should be supported, as well as gaining access to discounts, payment options, and other benefits. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">TWT is available on both the BNB Chain and Solana.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Are there any risks to using Trust Wallet?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While Trust Wallet is generally considered secure, there are some risks with using non-custodial wallets, since users are solely responsible for their private keys. Losing the 12-word recovery phrase means losing access to the wallet and the funds stored within it. \u003C/span>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Users also need to be vigilant against phishing attacks, where malicious actors attempt to steal private keys or recovery phrases by posing as legitimate entities. It is important for users to always ensure that theyre interacting with the official Trust Wallet website and app.\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> 2025 The Block. are cryptocurrency pairs?","beginners-guide-to-cryptocurrency-trading-different-pair-types","2024-08-30T16:55:40-04:00","4:55PM EDT","August 30, 2024, 4:55PM EDT","08/30/24","Aug 30, class=\"acf-media-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Ca href=\"theblock.co\" target=\"_blank\">The Block\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\"> | \u003Cspan class=\"acf-credit\">\u003Ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/photos/black-circuit-board-tmTidmpILWw?utm_content=creditCopyText&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=unsplash\" target=\"_blank\">Cristiano Firmani\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>","Understanding the various types of cryptocurrency pairs for successful trading","\u003Cp>Cryptocurrency trading involves buying and selling digital assets like bitcoin, ether and other cryptocurrencies on exchanges. Trading pairs represent two different cryptocurrencies that can be exchanged for one another on a trading platform.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Some of the most common pair types are fiat-to-crypto. This is where a traditional currency like the United States dollar is traded against a cryptocurrency like \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/249521/what-is-bitcoin-and-how-does-it-work-a-beginners-guide-to-btc-cryptocurrency\">bitcoin\u003C/a>. The pair is often labeled with the currencies separated by a slash, such as \u003Ca href=\"https://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf\">BTC\u003C/a>/USD or ETH/USD.Additionally, two digital currencies can be exchanged for each other, such as ETH/BTC.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cdiv>\r\n\u003Cp>The first currency listed is the base currency, while the second is the quote currency. For instance, in the BTC/USD pair, bitcoin is quoted in U.S. dollars; the price reflects how many dollars are needed to purchase one bitcoin. This concept extends to the crypto-to-crypto pairs, where the value signifies how much of one \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/learn/298592/what-is-cryptocurrency\">cryptocurrency\u003C/a> is needed to exchange for another.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>What can the price of crypto pairs tell us?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Looking at pairs can give a sense of the change in relative value between two cryptocurrencies regardless of their movement against a fiat currency such as the U.S. dollar.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>For example, while bitcoin and ether prices are highly correlated when quoted in U.S. dollars, their relative price can move. In mid-June 2017, ether could be bought for $343 while bitcoin was trading at $2,450. The price of ether in bitcoin terms was 0.14 BTC (think of it as $343/$2,450). Seven years later, in mid-June 2024, ether traded for $3,493 while bitcoin was at $66,139. However, the price of ether in bitcoin terms was then at 0.053 BTC ($3,493/$66,139), much lower than in 2017. That tells us that while both of those cryptocurrencies soared exponentially against the greenback over the course of seven years, bitcoin's value increased far more relative to ether's.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Why do people use crypto trading pairs?\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>People trade them for several key reasons:\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Diversification:\u003C/strong> Trading pairs allow investors to diversify their portfolios by exchanging one cryptocurrency for another.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Liquidity:\u003C/strong> They often offer high liquidity, making it easier for traders to enter and exit positions without significantly impacting the market price.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Market access:\u003C/strong> Some cryptocurrencies, particularly smaller and less-liquid ones, may not be directly tradable against fiat currencies. Trading pairs with more widely accepted cryptocurrencies, like bitcoin or ether, provide access to a broader range of digital assets.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Risk management:\u003C/strong> Investors can hedge against price movements in their primary assets using trading pairs. For example, if one holds a volatile cryptocurrency, one might trade it against a more stable asset to manage exposure.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Cp>Crypto trading pairs offer flexibility and strategies for optimizing trading outcomes and managing risk in the dynamic cryptocurrency market.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003C/div>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp> 2025 The Block. Announces Strategic Acquisition of KKRT Labs to Scale Confidentiality on Public Blockchains","zama-announces-strategic-acquisition-of-kkrt-labs-to-scale-confidentiality-on-public-blockchains","2025-11-05T05:02:36-05:00","5:02AM EST","November 5, 2025, 5:02AM EST","by ",[],[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/11/Untitled_design_1762279646T45NUftfSf-1125x675.jpg","Paris, France, November 5th, 2025, Chainwire Zama, the cryptography company behind the Zama Confidential Blockchain Protocol, today announced that it has acquired KKRT Labs, a pioneering research and development firm focused on scaling blockchains using Zero-Knowledge Proofs. This strategic acquisition strengthens Zama’s technical depth in blockchain scalability and validity (ZK) rollups, while accelerating its ability […]","\n                    \u003Cp class=\"sc-FeKFz hYlDaj\">\u003Cspan>\u003Cstrong>Paris, France, November 5th, 2025, Chainwire\u003C/strong>\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr>\u003Cp>\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.zama.org/\">\u003Cstrong>Zama\u003C/strong>\u003C/a>, the cryptography company behind the Zama Confidential Blockchain Protocol, today announced that it has acquired \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.kakarot.org\">\u003Cstrong>KKRT Labs\u003C/strong>\u003C/a>, a pioneering research and development firm focused on scaling blockchains using Zero-Knowledge Proofs. This strategic acquisition strengthens Zama’s technical depth in blockchain scalability and validity (ZK) rollups, while accelerating its ability to deliver high-performance confidentiality to all public blockchains.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Unlocking the Next Phase of Scalable Onchain Confidentiality\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>KKRT Labs (also known as “Kakarot”) brings deep expertise in designing high-performance proving architectures and modular rollup systems for Ethereum-equivalent environments. Backed by investors such as Vitalik Buterin, Starkware, Lambda Class, and Stake Capital, Kakarot is recognized as one of the strongest ZK-rollup teams in the ecosystem, aiming at building the most scalable, efficient proving engine for Ethereum-compatible chains.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>By joining forces, Zama and KKRT Labs will accelerate scalability efforts across the Zama Protocol, targeting 10,000+ confidential transactions per second on public chains such as Ethereum, Solana, and others. This new scale will open up critical financial applications on-chain, such as confidential stablecoin payments, confidential DeFi, or confidential on-chain asset management.\u003C/p>\u003Cblockquote>“KKRT Labs has assembled one of the best ZK-rollup teams in the world,” said \u003Cstrong>Rand Hindi\u003C/strong>, CEO at Zama. “Together, we will scale faster and reach new levels of performance, bringing the Zama Protocol to tens of thousands of transactions per second.”\u003C/blockquote>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Integration, Growth, and Future Roadmap\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>Beyond technical alignment, Zama and KKRT Labs share a common philosophy: a belief in open-source innovation, confidentiality-first infrastructure, and democratizing access to advanced cryptographic technology. Both teams have been driven by the conviction that scalability and confidentiality are not trade-offs, but complementary building blocks for the next generation of decentralized systems.\u003C/p>\u003Cblockquote>\u003Cstrong>Vitalik Buterin\u003C/strong>, co-founder of Ethereum and KKRT Labs investor, said: “Kakarot has played a significant role in advancing the state of cryptographic technologies in Ethereum, from their early pioneering work on ZK-EVMs to their work on client-side proving for privacy preservation. I look forward to seeing what the team's talented researchers and developers will do next.”\u003C/blockquote>\u003Cp>Zama is committed to ensuring a seamless integration of KKRT Labs:\u003C/p>\u003Cul>\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Team retention & leadership:\u003C/strong> KKRT’s key engineers, operations, and leadership will transition fully into Zama.\u003C/li>\u003Cli>\u003Cstrong>Roadmap alignment:\u003C/strong> KKRT’s ongoing initiatives will be integrated into Zama’s broader product and engineering roadmap with minimal disruption.\u003C/li>\u003C/ul>\u003Cblockquote>\u003Cstrong>Eli Ben Sasson\u003C/strong>, co-founder of ZCash and CEO of StarkWare, said: “I’ve had the privilege of collaborating with the exceptional Kakarot team over the years and witnessing firsthand what they can build. They’ve achieved tremendous success by taking a simple PoC from some of our engineers three years ago and turning it into impressive technology. They have a deep understanding of what it takes to scale blockchains using advanced cryptography, and I’m thrilled to see them dedicating their expertise to scaling and privacy. I’m sure they will provide pivotal support to Zama’s ambitious scaling roadmap.”\u003C/blockquote>\u003Cblockquote>“Joining Zama allows us to bring our expertise towards scaling one of the last major challenges in blockchain: confidentiality.” added \u003Cstrong>Clément Walter\u003C/strong>, co-founder, KKRT Labs. “We’ve always believed scalability and confidentiality are essential to the adoption of blockchains, and by joining forces with Zama we can finally make high-throughput, low latency confidential on-chain finance a reality.”\u003C/blockquote>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>About Zama\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.zama.ai/\">Zama\u003C/a> is a cryptography company building state-of-the-art FHE solutions for blockchain. Their flagship protocol, the Zama Protocol, adds a layer of confidentiality to existing chains such as Ethereum and Solana, enabling confidential payment, DeFi and more. Zama was founded by Dr. Pascal Paillier (FHE pioneer) and Dr. Rand Hindi (exited AI founder), has the largest research team in FHE, and raised $150m at a $1.2b valuation from Multicoin, Pantera, Protocol Labs, and others. To learn more about Zama, users can visit \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.zama.org/\">https://zama.org/\u003C/a>. \u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>About KKRT Labs\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.kakarot.org\">KKRT Labs\u003C/a> was a zero-knowledge R&D company focused on building modular proving engines for Ethereum-equivalent systems. Founded by experts in cryptography and blockchain architecture, KKRT Labs had an aim to make verifiable computing simple, fast, and accessible.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr>\u003Cbr />\u003Ch5>Contact\u003C/h5>\u003Cspan>\u003Cstrong>Kirsty Jarvis\u003C/strong>\u003Cbr />\u003C/span>\u003Cspan>\u003Cstrong>kirsty@luminouspr.com\u003C/strong>\u003Cbr />\u003C/span>\n 04, 2025",[],[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/11/image-2_1762248070VbdMo0tTWZ-1200x675.jpg","Los Angeles, USA, November 4th, 2025, Chainwire Mevolaxy, a US-based mevstake platform, has These two developments […]","\n                    \u003Cp class=\"sc-FeKFz hYlDaj\">\u003Cspan>\u003Cstrong>Los Angeles, USA, November 4th, 2025, Chainwire\u003C/strong>\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://mevolaxy.com/?ref=ctlph@gmail.com\">Mevolaxy\u003C/a>, a US-based mevstake platform, has released an intuitive mobile app to provide an easy solution for users who prefer managing their assets on the go. Additionally, the company announced that the latest investor payouts have set another record after the one set in June. These two developments highlight Mevolaxy's commitment to providing maximum user convenience as part of its community-centric approach.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Mevolaxy specializes in developing MEV bots and subsequently using them within the Mevstake system. Mevstake is the platform's proprietary technology that locks in the user's staking terms for the whole duration of their deposit. It can help users to better navigate market volatility and network changes.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The Mevstake system allows users to contribute funds to a network-wide bot liquidity pool and receive a share of the potential profits. This makes tools previously available only to major traders accessible to a broad audience.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The recent launch of the Mevolaxy mobile app means users can now access mevstake easily, even when away from their computers. The application is now available on the App Store. Early users already praised its speed, intuitive interface, and modern design. The app allows tracking accruals and statistics in real time, making interaction with the platform even more convenient.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Mevolaxy also announced the latest investor payouts, totaling approximately $3.6 million. This figure represents a new record for the company, surpassing the $3 million in payouts set in June 2025. Company representatives noted that the growing payouts are a testament to the sustainability of their model and the trust of their users.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>About Mevolaxy\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://mevolaxy.com/\">Mevolaxy\u003C/a> is a fintech company that seeks to expose users to blockchain-based earnings through advanced MEV strategies. The platform’s flagship product, the mevstake technology, aims to break down barriers and make MEV accessible to all users, regardless of their experience with cryptocurrencies.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The Mevolaxy team consists of blockchain infrastructure developers, financial analysts, cybersecurity engineers, DeFi specialists, marketers, and product managers. The company’s engineers have many years of experience working with high-load systems and advanced blockchain technologies from Ethereum, Solana, Arbitrum, zkSync, and other networks.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Users can use the \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://mevolaxy.com/?ref=ctlph@gmail.com\">Mevolaxy app\u003C/a> to access advanced staking tools securely and without complicated settings or hidden fees. Powered by $TEA","tea-fi-redefines-defi-one-superapp-infinite-yield-powered-by-tea","2025-11-03T03:09:55-05:00","3:09AM EST","November 3, 2025, 3:09AM EST","11/03/25","Nov 03, 2025",[],[],"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/11/main_17621554116S38JOAnyN-1125x675.jpg","Hong-Kong, Hong Kong SAR, November 3rd, 2025, Chainwire Tea-Fi, the all-in-one DeFi SuperApp, is setting a new benchmark for the future of DeFi by merging simplicity, scalability, and sustainability into one seamless experience. With over a million connected wallets, $650+ million in transaction volume, and over 20 million on-chain interactions, Tea-Fi is proving that DeFi […]","\n                    \u003Cp class=\"sc-FeKFz hYlDaj\">\u003Cspan>\u003Cstrong>Hong-Kong, Hong Kong SAR, November 3rd, 2025, Chainwire\u003C/strong>\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://tea-fi.com/\">Tea-Fi\u003C/a>, the all-in-one DeFi SuperApp, is setting a new benchmark for the future of DeFi by merging simplicity, scalability, and sustainability into one seamless experience. With over a million connected wallets, $650+ million in transaction volume, and over 20 million on-chain interactions, Tea-Fi is proving that DeFi can be both powerful and accessible.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">At the center of this ecosystem is the $TEA token, fueling a self-sustaining network built on real yield, shared value, and true decentralization, and a perpetual reward engine fueled by the TeaPOT.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">\u003Cimg src=\"https://app.chainwire.org/storage/uploads/users/Frame_2147224716_3_1762155766xSeyKenAnP.jpg\">\u003Cstrong>The Tea-Fi Vision: DeFi that Feels Effortless\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">DeFi’s biggest challenge has always been complexity: multiple wallets, gas fees, and fragmented liquidity. Tea-Fi solves this with a fully abstracted, multi-chain experience, making it as intuitive as a Web2 app while remaining fully decentralized.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Users can swap, stake, spend, and earn across 40+ blockchains without worrying about bridges or native gas.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Core Innovations Powering the Ecosystem\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>01. TeaPOT- Rewards Powered by Real Yield\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The TeaPOT is Tea-Fi’s protocol-owned liquidity vault, capturing platform fees and partner revenues to channel them back into $TEA buybacks, user rewards, and ecosystem growth.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">It is a sustainable yield engine based on real protocol revenue rather than emissions.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>02. Yield Engine - Optimized Rewards for All\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">From staking to synthetic assets, users can earn optimized rewards through Tea-Fi’s on-chain yield programs, all transparently tied to the protocol’s revenue streams.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>03. SuperSwap - Cross-Chain Swaps Made Simple\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Tea-Fi’s SuperSwap feature lets users swap and bridge across 40+ chains in one click, turning what was once a multi-step process into a single seamless transaction. \u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>04. Easy-Gas - Gasless by Design\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Users can pay fees in stablecoins or any of the supported tokens in their wallet, unlocking a truly gasless DeFi experience across over 40 blockchains, removing one of the biggest barriers to entry for everyday users.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>05. Self-Custodial Wallets\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Tea-Fi’s self-custodial smart wallet ensures users maintain full control over their assets, combining the convenience of web2 with the security of Web3.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>06. TeaCard \u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">With TeaCard, users can spend crypto in real life while feeding value back into the Tea-Fi ecosystem, bridging DeFi flexibility with real-world utility.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>07. Protocol-Aligned Apps (PAAs)\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Third-party dApps such as \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://noga.one/\">NOGA\u003C/a>, integrate directly into the Tea-Fi ecosystem, contributing to protocol revenue and expanding Tea-Fi’s reach across multiple DeFi verticals. By fueling the TeaPOT, they further strengthen the ecosystem’s self-sustaining economy\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>The $TEA Token: The Core of a Circular Economy\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The $TEA token lies at the heart of Tea-Fi’s flywheel. Every transaction, integration, and user activity flows into the TeaPOT, creating continuous buybacks, compounding rewards, and sustainable value capture.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">$TEA serves three primary roles:\u003C/p>\u003Cul>\u003Cli>Utility: Powers all yield, staking, and reward systems.\u003C/li>\u003Cli>Governance: When locked as vTEA, it grants voting power and boosts APYs.\u003C/li>\u003Cli>Value Capture: Feeds protocol revenue back into buybacks and incentives.\u003C/li>\u003C/ul>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The result is a deflationary token economy driven by usage, not speculation.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">\u003Cimg src=\"https://app.chainwire.org/storage/uploads/users/Frame_2147224721_2_1762155788f472tT7Nwb.jpg\">\u003Cstrong>Growth, Partnerships, and Traction\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">Tea-Fi’s rise has been powered by integrations with Polygon Labs, Katana, and NOGA, enabling frictionless scalability across ecosystems.\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">The numbers speak for themselves:\u003C/p>\u003Cul>\u003Cli>Over 2 million connected wallets\u003C/li>\u003Cli>20+ million transactions\u003C/li>\u003Cli>$560+ million total volume\u003C/li>\u003Cli>$5+ million TVL\u003C/li>\u003Cli>1+ million global users\u003C/li>\u003C/ul>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>The Road Ahead: Activating the $TEA Economy\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">TGE goes live at 12 PM UTC, 3 November 2025 on Kraken, Kucoin and MEXC unlocking the next phase of Tea-Fi’s mission to empower users through governance, yield participation, and vTEA alignment. Tea-Fi’s goal is clear: make DeFi as easy as traditional finance, owned by the users, powered by real yield, and built to last.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>About Tea-Fi\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp class=\"ql-align-justify\">\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://tea-fi.com/\">Tea-Fi\u003C/a> is a DeFi SuperApp that merges the usability of Web2 with the transparency of Web3. Through innovations like account abstraction, multi-chain compatibility, and its protocol-owned liquidity vault (TeaPOT), Tea-Fi enables users to experience DeFi as it was meant to be: simple, This milestone marks a significant […]","\n                    \u003Cp class=\"sc-FeKFz hYlDaj\">\u003Cspan>\u003Cstrong>Panama City, Panama, November 3rd, 2025, Chainwire\u003C/strong>\u003C/span>\u003C/p>\u003Cbr>\u003Cp>Gate Group, a world-leading player in the crypto space, has officially announced that Gate Information Pty Ltd (\"Gate Australia\") is registered with the Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre (AUSTRAC) as a Digital Currency Exchange Provider and is now officially live at \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.gate.com/en-au\">www.gate.com/en-au\u003C/a>. This milestone marks a significant step forward in Gate Group’s global compliance strategy.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>In terms of services, Gate Australia offers fully localized websites, products, and features designed to provide local users with a seamless cryptocurrency trading and asset management experience. The platform integrates multiple security measures, including SSL-encrypted connections, offline Bitcoin wallet technology, two-factor authentication (2FA), as well as instant deposit and withdrawal capabilities, ensuring both asset security and transaction stability, and further enhancing the user experience.\u003C/p>\u003Cblockquote>The Founder and CEO of Gate Group, Dr. Han, stated: \"Compliance, transparency, and user protection are core principles at Gate. Australia has a robust regulatory framework and an open financial environment. The official launch of Gate Australia not only represents an important step in our global compliance strategy but also underscores our long-term commitment to providing secure and trusted services for users worldwide.\"\u003C/blockquote>\u003Cp>Currently, Gate entities are registered, licensed, or authorized in multiple jurisdictions, including Malta, the Bahamas, Hong Kong, Japan, Australia, and Dubai. The launch of Gate Australia further strengthens the Group’s compliance footprint in key global markets and demonstrates its capability and commitment to deepening localized operations.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>As a leading pioneer in the global crypto industry, Gate Group remains dedicated to “security, transparency, and compliance.” With 100% reserve proof and a comprehensive risk management system, Gate provides a reliable trading environment for users. Looking ahead, Gate Group will continue to expand its global compliance presence and promote a safer, more transparent crypto ecosystem.\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>About Gate Group\u003C/strong>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>Founded in 2013, Gate Group is a pioneer in the cryptocurrency industry, with its flagship platform,\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"http://gate.com/\"> Gate.com\u003C/a>, serving over 43 million users and ranking among the Top 3 crypto exchanges worldwide by market share. \u003C/p>\u003Cp>For more information, users can visit: \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.gate.com/\">Website\u003C/a> |\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://x.com/gate\"> X\u003C/a> |\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://t.me/GateCom_EN\"> Telegram\u003C/a> |\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/gateio/\"> LinkedIn\u003C/a>|\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.instagram.com/gate.com_global\"> Instagram\u003C/a> |\u003Ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" href=\"https://www.youtube.com/@GateExchange\"> YouTube\u003C/a>\u003C/p>\u003Cp>\u003Cstrong>Disclaimer\u003C/strong>:\u003C/p>\u003Cp>This content does not constitute an offer, solicitation, or recommendation.
