Bitcoin is still trading above $100,000 after a bruising week of downside volatility, now buoyed by renewed institutional inflows and signs of whale accumulation that, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377985/bitcoin-100k-whale-buying-etf-inflows-sentiment\">analysts say\u003C/a>, suggest confidence is quietly returning to the largest cryptocurrency by market cap.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>In today's newsletter, Jack Dorsey's Block sees nearly $2 billion in bitcoin revenue in Q3, Kazakhstan plans to launch a $1 billion crypto reserve fund by 2026, JPMorgan says IREN's AI-cloud expansion is driving long-term upside but a near-term strain on its balance sheet, and more.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Let's get started!\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>P.S. Don't forget to check out The Funding, a biweekly rundown of crypto VC trends. It's a great read  and just like The Daily, it's \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/newsletters?select=The%20Funding&utm_campaign=website&utm_campaign=website&utm_campaign=website&utm_medium=referral&utm_medium=referral&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=newsletter&utm_source=newsletter&utm_source=newsletter\">free to subscribe\u003C/a>!\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Bitcoin drives nearly a third of Q3 revenue for Jack Dorsey's Block\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377971/block-q3-earnings\">Jack Dorsey's Block generated $1.97 billion in bitcoin revenue for Q3\u003C/a>  nearly one-third of its total revenues  despite an 18% year-over-year decline.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The fintech and bitcoin infrastructure firm reported third-quarter earnings of $461.5 million on revenue of $6.11 billion during the period, according to its 10-Q filing with the SEC on Thursday.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Block delivered 18% gross profit growth year-over-year, led by 24% growth in Cash App and 9% growth in Square, Dorsey wrote in a shareholder letter.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>However, adjusted operating income of $409 million and EBITDA of $833 million both landed below consensus estimates.\u003Cbr />\r\nBitcoin now represents Block's second-largest revenue source behind subscription and services-based revenue.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Block's bitcoin costs also dropped to $1.89 billion in Q3, though its 8,780 BTC balance sheet holdings booked a $59 million quarterly remeasurement loss.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Block shares closed down 3.7% on Thursday and have fallen a further 8.2% in Friday trading to around $65, according to The Block's price page.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The company recently expanded its bitcoin ecosystem with new fee-free BTC payments for Square merchants, adding to its BitKey wallet device and mining hardware plans.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Ch2>Kazakhstan to launch $1 billion crypto reserve fund using seized assets by 2026\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377998/kazakhstan-to-launch-1-billion-crypto-reserve-fund-using-seized-assets-by-2026-bloomberg\">Kazakhstan will launch a $500 million to $1 billion national crypto reserve fund\u003C/a> by early 2026, in part using seized and repatriated assets plus proceeds from state mining, Bloomberg reported.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Central bank Governor Timur Suleimenov said the fund's investments would also include ETFs and crypto firms, but it would be \"very careful about direct exposure to cryptocurrencies.\"\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The move marks Kazakhstan's most concrete step toward institutionalizing its crypto strategy after years of experiments with state mining operations and tighter oversight of private miners.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The reserve will be managed under the Astana International Financial Centre  the country's main financial hub for blockchain and fintech development  and may include foreign partners once operational, according to officials.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Ch2>IREN's AI-cloud expansion driving long-term upside but near-term strain on balance sheet: JPMorgan\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/378045/iren-ai-cloud-expansion-upside-near-term-strain-jpmorgan\">JPMorgan analysts said IREN's $9.7 billion Microsoft deal cements its shift into AI infrastructure long-term\u003C/a>, but warned the rapid buildout will strain its balance sheet as the company spends more than $9 billion on GPUs and data-center expansion over the next year.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The analysts raised their December 2026 price target for IREN to $28, citing strong AI-cloud momentum and new hyperscale partnerships, while flagging dilution risk from equity issuance and convertible note conversions.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>IREN expects the Microsoft contract to generate roughly $1.94 billion in annual recurring revenue with project-level margins near 85%, supporting its plan to scale to 140,000 GPUs and $3.4 billion in run-rate revenue by 2026.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The bitcoin miner's shares traded around $60 on Friday after a sharp post-earnings pullback, but remain more than double JPMorgan's target, reflecting investor enthusiasm for its AI pivot.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Ch2>Bybit and Backed partner to bring tokenized Nvidia and Strategy stocks to Mantle\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/378030/bybit-backed-xstocks-tokenized-nvidia-mstr-mantle\">Bybit and Backed Finance have teamed up to bring tokenized shares\u003C/a> of companies like Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft, and Strategy onto the Mantle Layer 2 network.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The collaboration lets users move assets between Bybit and Mantle for faster onboarding and deeper liquidity while enabling non-U.S. investors to access the tokenized equities permissionlessly.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Backed's xStocks, integrated with Kraken and major Solana DeFi protocols since June, have already surpassed $1.6 billion in onchain volume, the company said.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Real-world assets, including tokenized equities, are expected by some to grow into a multi-trillion-dollar market.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Ch2>Zcash tops $10B market cap, surpassing Hyperliquid to reclaim top-20 spot\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/378025/zcash-tops-10-billion-usd-market-cap\">Zcash surged past a $10 billion market cap on Friday\u003C/a>, flipping cycle-darling Hyperliquid to reclaim a top 20 spot after surging more than 25% over the past 24 hours to add to its ongoing Q4 rally.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>The privacy-focused cryptocurrency climbed from $75 to more than $700 in six weeks, reaching its highest level since 2018 even as major cryptocurrencies continued to slump in the wake of the Oct. 10 historic liquidation event.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Rising shielded supply, stronger wallet infrastructure, and renewed privacy narratives are driving usage, liquidity, and prices higher, analysts said, with Maelstrom's Arthur Hayes calling for a $1,000 near-term target.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Ch2>Looking ahead to next week\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cul>\r\n\t\u003Cli>UK GDP figures are due on Thursday, followed by U.S. CPI inflation data and jobless claims. Eurozone GDP numbers are released on Friday.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Euler, Axie Infinity, Aptos, Linea, Movement, IOTA, Avalanche, and Wormhole are among the crypto projects set for \u003Ca href=\"https://tokenomist.ai/\">token unlocks\u003C/a>.\u003C/li>\r\n\t\u003Cli>Mining Disrupt Conference & Expo, Bitcoin Amsterdam, and Crypto Fest 2025 all get underway.\u003C/li>\r\n\u003C/ul>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Cem>Never miss a beat with The Block's\u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/newsletters?utm_campaign=website&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=newsletter\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">daily digest\u003C/a>of the most influential events happening across the digital asset\u003C/em>ecosystem.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: This article was produced with the assistance of OpenAI’s ChatGPT 3.5/4 and reviewed and edited by our editorial team.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. You can send Naga scoops and intel via @shogunaga on Telegram.",{"twitter":1568,"linkedin":18,"email":18,"telegram":1569},"https://x.com/JeSuisNaga","https://t.me/shogunaga",[1571],{"name":1572,"email":1573},"Adam James","ajames@theblock.co","https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/08/outage-hack-network-1200x675.jpg","\u003Ch4>Quick Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>Balancer has released its preliminary report on the Nov. 3 exploit that drained millions in assets from Composable Stable Pools across multiple networks.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The protocol cited a rounding flaw in its swap logic, which attackers exploited to manipulate pool balances and extract value.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","Balancers preliminary report says a rounding flaw in swap logic caused the recent exploit, with recovery efforts underway across affected chains and forks.","\u003Cp>DeFi protocol Balancer has published its preliminary incident report on the Nov. 3 exploit that drained tens of millions from its Composable Stable Pools (CSPs) across multiple networks, including Ethereum, Base, Avalanche, Arbitrum, Optimism, Gnosis, Polygon, Berachain, and Sonic.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>As \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377223/defi-protocol-balancer-potentially-exploited-as-onchain-data-shows-millions-in-outflows\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Block\u003C/a> previously reported, the decentralized automated market maker (AMM) and liquidity platform suffered massive outflows from its vault. Initial estimates of the loss quickly rose from around $70 million to over $128 million within a few hours, blockchain analytics providers like Nansen and Peckshield reported.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>According to Balancer, its security partner Hypernative first detected the suspicious activity early Monday. Several contributors and whitehat responders, such as SEAL 911, BitFinding, and StakeWise, were then contacted to help stem the bleed.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Root cause: rounding flaw in swap logic\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>In its \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/Balancer/status/1986104426667401241\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">preliminary report\u003C/a>, Balancer attributed the exploit to a rounding error in the upscale function for EXACT_OUT swaps within the v2 vaults batchSwap feature. This function allows users to combine multiple swap operations into a single transaction to save gas.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Attackers exploited how deferred settlement was implemented in composable pools, which allowed liquidity to fall below minimum thresholds, the team explained. Specifically, the bug occurred when non-integer scaling factors caused the system to round down during specific calculations, creating small discrepancies that the attacker leveraged to manipulate balances and drain value.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>In many instances, funds were first redirected into the Balancer Vaults internal balances before being withdrawn through follow-up transactions. The bug primarily affected Composable Stable v5 pools with expired pause windows, while Hypernatives emergency automation automatically paused v6 pools.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The incident was limited to Composable Stable Pools on Balancer v2 and its forks on other chains such as BEX and Beets, Balancer wrote. Balancer v3 and all other pool types remain unaffected.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Meanwhile, CSPv6 pools were automatically transitioned into recovery mode under emergency controls.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Multi-chain impact and recovery\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Balancer said the attack spanned several networks and forks, including BEX on Berachain, Beets on Sonic, and Gnosis-based deployments. However, ecosystem partners initiated emergency actions to contain the fallout. StakeWise DAO \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/stakewise_io/status/1985462161670336944\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">recovered\u003C/a> approximately $19 million in osETH and $1.7 million in osGNO, roughly 73.5% of the stolen osETH. Berachain validators \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377257/berachain-emergency-hardfork\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">halted\u003C/a> the network to perform an emergency hard fork addressing BEXs v2 exposure, which was \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/377407/berachain-hard-fork-binary\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">completed\u003C/a> on Nov. 4.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Also, Sonic Labs \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/SonicLabs/status/1985401737096671549\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">froze\u003C/a> suspected attacker addresses, restricting fund movements tied to its Balancer fork. Gnosis temporarily \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/gnosisdotio/status/1985321081255891396\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">restricted\u003C/a> bridge activity to prevent cross-chain propagation, while Monerium froze 1.3 million EURe in the affected vault.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Additionally, BitFinding and Base MEV bots recovered smaller sums  about $750,000 in total  and \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/BitFinding/status/1985542900873072882\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">returned\u003C/a> them to the Balancer DAO. The team added that a portion of the affected assets has been recovered or frozen and that a final verified accounting will be published once all partners complete on-chain reconciliation.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Balancer claims that any circulating loss figures are unconfirmed until independent verification is concluded.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Mitigations and next steps\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>As part of its response, Balancer has disabled the CSPv6 factory to prevent the creation of new vulnerable pools and halted liquidity gauges for affected pools to stop further emissions.\u003Cbr />\r\nFurthermore, the team has enabled liquidity pool exits from paused pools to allow safe withdrawals.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The protocols Safe Harbor legal framework (BIP-726), adopted last year, allowed whitehat teams to intervene immediately without legal risk, a structure Balancer said materially improved response speed and coordination.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>A final report, including confirmed loss and recovery figures, is expected once all partner validations are complete, according to Balancers latest update.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. other pool types remained unaffected.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Attackers manipulated balances by exploiting a rounding flaw during deferred settlement in composable pools, primarily affecting expired pause Crypto\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>","\u003Ch4>Quick Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>Arx Research raised a $6.1 million seed round led by Castle Island Ventures, with participation from Inflection, Placeholder, Seed Club Ventures, and 1kx.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The raise supports Arx Research’s “Burner Terminal” launch  a handheld point-of-sale device that lets merchants accept crypto, stablecoins, and fiat via a single unit.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","The seed round was led by Castle Island Ventures, with participation from Inflection, Placeholder, Seed Club Ventures, and 1kx.","\u003Cp>Hardware and software firm Arx Research has raised a $6.1 million seed round led by Castle Island Ventures, with participation from Inflection, Placeholder, Seed Club Ventures, and 1kx.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The round was structured as a Simple Agreement for Future Equity (SAFE), Arx Research co-founder and CEO Cameron Robertson told The Block, declining to disclose the timing or a post-money valuation.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The funding supports the launch of \"Burner Terminal\"  a handheld point-of-sale device that brings digital assets and traditional payments into a single unit. The terminal accepts stablecoins and both contactless and chip-and-PIN cards, with EMV certification for security, compliance, and compatibility with existing payment systems. EMV-certified means the device meets the technical standards set by EMV  a global specification created by Europay, Mastercard, and Visa for payment cards and terminals.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"Stablecoins have already proven themselves for high-value payments and b2b, but the last mile to physical retail has been missing,\" Castle Island Ventures Founding Partner Nic Carter said. \"Burner Terminal makes them relevant to brick and mortar for the first time.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The compact device also integrates with the digital payments network Flexa, offering merchants optional support for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and other crypto assets, as well as stablecoins.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"We built Burner Terminal from the ground up to give both merchants and customers a new way to pay that has the benefits of cash without being tied to traditional payment rails that incur high fees,\" Robertson said. \"Burner Terminal brings stablecoin payments into the physical world with the same simplicity as tapping a card.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Aimed at small merchants  from food trucks to salons  the Burner Terminal offers tap-to-pay crypto payments that operate outside traditional EMV card rails, allowing direct stablecoin transactions without intermediaries or chargebacks, the team explained in a statement. Customers can pay by tapping a phone or a Burner Card, or by scanning a QR code with any supported wallet, with built-in WiFi and LTE, letting merchants take payments anywhere.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"Depending on how the merchant wants to receive funds (e.g. as stablecoins, off-ramped to a bank account or from traditional cards) fees will vary, but we anticipate the minimum fee structures will be close to free if merchants want to accept and hold stablecoins directly,\" Robertson said.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>Doubling down on stablecoin payments\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>The fresh capital will also be used to scale manufacturing, expand the Burner ecosystem, and prepare for commercial availability, Robertson said, adding that the company plans to grow its six-person team to support distribution. \"We're doubling down on making direct stablecoin payments as easy to use as traditional payments.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The Burner Terminal builds on Arx Research's earlier Burner Wallet, which the company claims is used by more than 30,000 merchants and consumers. The two products are intended to function as a unified payments stack for small businesses.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"Burner Wallet (same as Card) is the first hardware wallet that will demonstrate Burner Terminal's novel tap to pay capability. Burner wallet will go live very soon with large ecommerce retailers and is anticipated to arrive in major physical retailers next year,\" Robertson said. \"We're also exploring ways to bring Burner's tap to pay capability directly to smartphones so that existing users can 'import' their cards into a virtual form the same way that they do with traditional credit cards.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Burner Terminal will first launch in the United States, with expansion into the EU and Latin America anticipated pending certification, according to Robertson. The device is set to debut this month, with full commercial availability planned for early 2026.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.\u003C/p>\n\u003C/span>","\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>Arx Research has raised $6.1 million in a seed round led by Castle Island Ventures to launch “Burner Terminal,” a point-of-sale device that combines digital and traditional payments.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The Burner Terminal is EMV-certified, accepting stablecoins, contactless, and chip-and-PIN card payments, and integrates with Flexa for additional cryptocurrency support.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Designed for small merchants, the terminal facilitates tap-to-pay crypto transactions without traditional payment intermediaries, and offers versatile fee structures for receiving funds.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Funding will also support manufacturing scale-up, Burner ecosystem expansion, and team growth to advance stablecoin payments for commercial use.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Arx Research aims to unify digital and physical retail payments, building on its existing Burner Wallet used by over 30,000 merchants and consumers.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Burner Terminal is set to debut in the U.S., with plans for EU and Latin American expansion, targeting commercial availability by early 2026.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n",{"name":1633,"url":1634,"id":1659,"description":1660},57638,"\u003Cp>Crypto deals & news around deals being rumored in the tops $10B market cap, surpassing Hyperliquid to reclaim top-20 spot amid continued surge","zcash-tops-10-billion-usd-market-cap",[],"2025-11-07T10:09:04-05:00","10:09AM EST","November 7, 2025, 10:09AM Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>Zcash has surpassed Hyperliquid, catapulting back into the top 20 cryptocurrencies as its continued surge sees it eclipse a $10 billion market cap.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Arthur Hayes said ZEC has now become the second-largest liquid asset in Maelstrom’s portfolio behind BTC, gaining around 750% since October.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","Arthur Hayes said ZEC has become the second-largest liquid asset in Maelstrom's portfolio behind BTC, gaining 750% since October.","\u003Cp>Privacy-focused cryptocurrency Zcash re-entered the top 20 cryptocurrencies on Friday with a market cap of $10.9 billion, flipping cycle-darling Hyperliquid's $10.8 billion.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Despite the broader crypto slump, Zcash has defied the market, jumping more than 25% in the past 24 hours and extending a rally thats lifted ZEC roughly 750% since the start of October, according to \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/price/248496/zcash-zec-usd\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Blocks prices page\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Zcash was changing hands for around $75 on Oct. 1, having traded in a range between $20 and $80 for much of the past three years. Following a resurgence in interest, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/374131/zcash-reclaims-200-level-after-three-years-amid-renewed-interest-in-privacy-coins\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ZEC reclaimed the $200 level\u003C/a> for the first time since 2022 by Oct. 10  shrugging off the largest liquidation event in crypto history  and going on to reach more than $680 on Friday at the time of writing.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>That marks the highest price point for Zcash since early 2018, though it remains far below a \u003Ca href=\"https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/zcash\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CoinGecko\u003C/a>-listed all-time high of more than $3,000 from October 2016  a period when circulating supply was very limited and early trading distorted prices.\u003C/p>\r\n\r\n\u003Cdiv id=\"attachment_378032\"class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"max-width: 974px;\">\u003Cimg class=\"has-caption size-full wp-image-378032\" src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/11/Screenshot-2025-11-07-at-14.54.30.png\" alt=\"ZEC/USD price chart. Image: The Block/TradingView.\" width=\"964\" height=\"635\" />\u003Cp class=\"wp-caption-text\">ZEC/USD price chart. Image: \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/price/248496/zcash-zec-usd\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Block/TradingView\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\u003C/div>\r\n\r\n\u003Cp>In contrast, most cryptocurrencies have struggled. Bitcoin is down about 18% since Oct. 10, \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/price/248349/ethereum-eth-usd\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ether has fallen 26%\u003C/a>, and the \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/indices/top/277090/gmci-30-gm30\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GMCI 30\u003C/a>  an index tracking the top 30 digital assets  has slumped 25%, with smaller tokens generally faring even worse.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ciframe frameborder=\"0\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/prices/price-performance-30d/embed\" title=\"Price Performance (30D)\" width=\"100%\">\u003C/iframe>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>'Encrypted Bitcoin'\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>Supporters pointed to a mix of narratives behind the upswing, from renewed debates over financial surveillance in Europe to fresh attention on Zcash's mobile wallet integrations, and rising volumes across the sector as catalysts.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Zcash is a privacy-optional blockchain that allows users to transfer their tokens to a privacy pool, effectively \"shielding\" their transaction history. Shielded supply refers to the ZEC tokens stored in private addresses that utilize zero-knowledge proofs (zk-SNARKs). This allows transaction validation without revealing the sender, receiver, or amount.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The significant rise in shielded supply of late suggests growing trust in Zcash's features and improved infrastructure support, driven by renewed attention to privacy-focused cryptocurrencies and vocal community advocacy, The Block's research analysts Brandon Kae and Ivan Wu \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/376312/zcash-shielded-supply-privacy-token-surges-7x\">wrote\u003C/a> last week.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Further, the sustained increase in shielded supply is a meaningful indicator of actual usage, as holders must opt in to shield tokens rather than passively holding them in self-custody or exchange wallets, they said.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\u003Ciframe frameborder=\"0\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://www.theblock.co/data/on-chain-metrics/comparison-bitcoin-ethereum-solana/zcash-shielded-supply/embed\" title=\"ZCash Shielded Supply\" width=\"100%\">\u003C/iframe>\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Meanwhile, Nansen Senior Research Analyst Jake Kennis said Zcash's eight-year high is being fueled by several key drivers.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>\"Privacy is increasingly viewed as a necessity rather than a feature, renewing ideological demand for private, self-sovereign transactions,\" Kennis told The Block on Friday. \"On the technical front, Zcash's zero-knowledge architecture, the Zashi wallet enabling shielded transfers, and Solana integration all improve usability and accessibility. Its Bitcoin-like tokenomics, a fixed 21M supply, Proof-of-Work consensus, and upcoming halving that will reduce new issuance combined with zk-SNARK-enabled privacy, position it as an 'encrypted Bitcoin.'\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>In terms of market activity, both spot and futures taker volume is curving up, CryptoQuant analyst Maartunn told The Block. \"It shows that investors and traders are both buying aggressively into the privacy coin hype,\" he said.\u003C/p>\r\n\r\n\u003Cdiv id=\"attachment_378027\"class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"max-width: 1290px;\">\u003Cimg class=\"has-caption size-full wp-image-378027\" src=\"https://www.tbstat.com/wp/uploads/2025/11/zcq.jpeg\" alt=\"Zcash spot taker CVD. Image: CryptoQuant.\" width=\"1280\" height=\"720\" />\u003Cp class=\"wp-caption-text\">Zcash spot taker CVD. Image: CryptoQuant.\u003C/p>\u003C/div>\r\n\r\n\u003Cp>However, there is \"speculation beyond the technology at this point,\" Nansen's Kennis warned, having increased by over 1,486% in just the last 3 months. \"The funding rate is extremely negative, and there have been many liquidations for those short recently,\" he said.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Ch2>ZEC now second-largest liquid holding behind BTC for Arthur Hayes' family office Maelstrom\u003C/h2>\r\n\u003Cp>The positive price action for Zcash has brought in renewed attention from high-profile figures like former BitMEX CEO Arthur Hayes, Kennis noted, \"attracting fresh capital flows after years of underperformance.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Hayes, now co-founder and CIO of family office Maelstrom, \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/CryptoHayes/status/1986772900070695039\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">said\u003C/a> Friday that due to its rapid ascent in price, ZEC is now the second-largest liquid holding in Maelstrom's portfolio behind BTC  prompting concerns from some about top signals amid the ongoing hype.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Earlier in the day, Hayes had \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/CryptoHayes/status/1986696636685258763\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">suggested\u003C/a> Zcash's shielded transactions would power the next wave of \"true DEXs\"  \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/CryptoHayes/status/1986332585115488641\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">arguing\u003C/a> ZEC could soon hit a price target of $1,000.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. target=\"_blank\">Shutterstock\u003C/a>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>\u003C/span>","\u003Ch4>Quick Take\u003C/h4>\n\u003Cul>\n\u003Cli>Ross Calvin, CEO of Bitcoin mining firm Parhelion, is looking to build a 450-foot tall statue of Prometheus on San Francisco’s Alcatraz Island, and will soon present a pitch to President Trump, according to a Bloomberg report.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>The statue would dwarf the Statue of Liberty, and would be made of a nickel-bronze alloy.\u003C/li>\n\u003C/ul>\n","The proposed Prometheus statue, at 450 feet, would dwarf the Statue of Liberty, at just 305 feet, and would be made of a nickel-bronze alloy. ","\u003Cp>A Bitcoin mining entrepreneur plans to pitch the President of the United States on a massive 450-foot tall statue of Prometheus, a project that could cost $450 million, as first reported by \u003Ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2025-10-17/america-s-tech-right-is-obsessed-with-building-giant-statues\">Bloomberg\u003C/a>.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Ross Calvin, head of Bitcoin mining firm \u003Ca href=\"https://parheliondigital.com/main/#:~:text=,Carbon\">Parhelion\u003C/a>, is working to build the statue on San Francisco's Alcatraz Island, the site of the infamous prison that was decommissioned in 1963. Currently a national park, the site would have to be re-classified as a national monument by President Trump in order for the statue to be built.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>The statue, which would be made from a nickel-bronze alloy, would dwarf the Statue of Liberty, which stands 305 feet tall, compared to the proposed Prometheus' 450 feet. The statue would be more than half as tall as the tallest points of the Golden Gate Bridge, which stand 746 feet above the water.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Calvin is leading the project through his \u003Ca href=\"https://americancolossus.org/\">American Colossus nonprofit\u003C/a>, which calls the proposed statue \"a lightning rod for the noble destiny of the West\" and \"America's monument to beauty, heroism, ingenuity, and manifest destiny.\" Calvin told Bloomberg the nonprofit is aiming to submit a detailed pitch, with renderings of the monument and plans for an on-site museum, to President Trump by the end of January.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Calvin launched a \u003Ca href=\"https://dexscreener.com/solana/BF7JDmRoDWNHfJ4UvHNYNxxXiP5SamQkH6KppTV1kBLV\">Prometheus memecoin\u003C/a> through \u003Ca href=\"https://www.theblock.co/post/354859/jito-validator-tips-hit-3-6-million-daily-as-believe-ecosystem-siphons-activity-from-pump-fun\">launchpad Believe\u003C/a> in mid-July 2025, though the token failed to gain traction, with a current market capitalization of only around $12,000. The American Colossus website explains, \"We casually experimented with a digital token on BelieveApp ... We had no expectations for it and quickly moved on.\"\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Alt-right philosopher Jason Jorjani \u003Ca href=\"https://x.com/Jason_Jorjani/status/1766649647328805045\">once announced his involvement in the project\u003C/a>, but is currently no longer listed as a team member on the nonprofit's website.\u003C/p>\r\n\u003Cp>Calvin's Parhelion, based in Denver, boasts 25 MW of compute capacity operating in Kurdish Iraq, according to the \u003Ca href=\"https://parheliondigital.com/main/#:~:text=,Carbon\">mining firm's website\u003C/a>, with additional compute capacity currently under development in Syria, Egypt, Libya, and Algeria. Calvin began mining Bitcoin in 2013, according to the website.\u003C/p>\u003Cbr />\u003Cspan class=\"copyright\">\u003Cp>Disclaimer: The Block is an independent media outlet that delivers news, research, and data. American Colossus, with plans to present a pitch to President Trump by January’s end.\u003C/li>\n\u003Cli>Prometheus’ statue would outsize the Statue of Liberty, incorporating a nickel-bronze alloy Gemini and Venmo cards are limited to U.S. customers. Nexo and Crypto.com serve multiple regions, including much of Europe and the U.K., while EtherFi, Payy, and Avici are still in early rollout phases with more limited country coverage. Always check the issuers site for the most up-to-date eligibility, as licensing and partnerships affect where these cards can be offered.",{"question":2590,"answer":2591},"How do I choose the right crypto credit card based on my crypto portfolio?","If you hold a long-term position in Bitcoin or Ether, choose a card that lets you earn directly in those assets. If youre more active and prefer altcoins or stablecoins, look for cards with flexible reward conversion options. The right choice balances your preferred reward type with practical considerations like fees and availability.",{"question":2593,"answer":2594},"How does the scoring system work?","Each card is rated across five categories: Function, Cost, Benefits, Security, and Usability. projects based on their circulating market capitalization, while enforcing minimum liquidity requirements. It consists of various blockchain projects, ensuring representation across different sectors and technological approaches within the cryptocurrency space. Beyond the key players, the GMCI Small Cap delves into the tail end of digital assets, usually exhibiting higher price volatility. The diversity within the index ensures that investors gain exposure to a broad spectrum of assets, from web3 applications to DeFi tokens and infrastructure projects. As the crypto world evolves, this index serves as a barometer for market trends, reflecting shifts in investor sentiment and risk appetite. For those looking to track the performance of small-cap cryptocurrencies and evaluate their growth potential, the GMCI Small Cap is a useful The changes will take effect with the next rebalancing on June 27. 00:00:00","GMRWA","Top RWA tokens","https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66048277c2c44d451daa4c04/6889eb752edab4b4fce860ba_GMCI%20RWA%20Methodology.pdf","\u003Cp>The GMCI Real World Assets (RWA) contains the leading RWA projects, spotlighting platforms and products that help bring traditional assets onchain. These assets include, but are not limited to, real estate, commodities, government and corporate bonds, art, and other physical or financial instruments. By leveraging blockchain technology, these projects enable investors to access, trade, and hold liquid fractionalized shares of these real-world assets securely and transparently.\u003C/p>\n\u003Cp>This index is designed for investors seeking diversified exposure to the emerging sector of tokenized real-world assets, combining the benefits of traditional finance with the efficiency and accessibility of blockchain technology. As RWAs come onchain, the GMCI RWA serves as a reliable barometer for the health, resilience, and evolution of tokenizing assets on the blockchain, providing investors with a comprehensive guide to navigating this groundbreaking sector.\u003C/p>\n","Feb 24,
